title: Data AI Architect
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Technology Infrastructure seeks an AI/Data Architect to design, implement, and manage leading AIOps (AI for IT Operations) solutions. You will drive the data strategy for AIOps and be involved in building products from conception to production. By leveraging leading-edge technologies and various data sources, you will design AI- services that will facilitate informed decision-making and business process optimization that will reduce outages and reduce downtime for the RBC services, thus saving significant amounts of money and improving user experience. Passion for data and building next-gen AI products, delighting your users is your ultimate mission.

What will you do?
• Partner with the product manager, technology teams, and various business and operation units to identify opportunities, conduct workshops, and translate them into a data roadmap
• Understand business issues and decompose them into measurable data or AI requirements
• Analyze data from different sources/LOBs and provide key insights and recommendations to integrate with existing platforms or make necessary changes to accommodate new data
• Collaborate with data science and engineering teams to define, design, and execute against the product roadmap that supports the business objectives
• Build and manage data and AI platforms/products to support development, research, and integration requirements
• Drive value articulation and communicate product and service benefits to our users and internal stakeholders
• Research vendors providing AI, MLOps, and AIOps domain-centric solutions, evaluate, conduct POCs, and provide recommendations on integration within the current ecosystem to drive tangible outcomes

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
• Master’s degree or Ph.D. in a technology/analytical field such as Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Engineering, or other relevant technology fields
• A minimum of seven years of relevant professional experience in an Agile environment with an excellent understanding of the underlying data and information modeling lifecycle
• Expert knowledge in data architecting, data mining, large-scale data modeling, and business requirements gathering/analysis. Strong familiarity with implementing enterprise data management processes, procedures, and decision support
• Expertise in designing, building, supporting, and maintaining Data Management, Data Warehouse, and/or Date Lake solutions and in estimating the storage, and computing requirements based on the requirements
• Hands-on knowledge of cloud tools, enterprise repository tools, data modeling tools, data mapping tools, and data profiling tools
• Ability to converse with business and technical partners to gather business requirements and translate them into entity relationship planning, data design, and implementation plan
• Experience in building batch and real-time data pipelines to support ML/Deep Learning training and inferencing architecture. Experience with MLOps and or data Ops will be a plus
• Quickly learn new methods, tools, and technologies presented in research communities to implement and adapt within the daily analytics exercises. Exceptional interpersonal, persuasion, and communication skills to communicate strategic and technical ideas to internal audiences to both inform and solicit buy-in from the end-user community

Nice to Have
• Good knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws and can represent the team in periodic councils to require approvals and audits
• Exposure to technology and operation data domains
• Exposure to complex ML/Deep Learning modeling techniques
• Familiarity with ITSM, ITOM, Observability, and SRE principles

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference in our communities, and achieving mutual success.
• A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
• Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
• Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
• Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
• A world-class training program in financial services
• Flexible work/life balance options
• Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

#LI-Post

#TECHPJ

Architectural Modeling, Critical Thinking, Data Architecture, Data Management, Data Modeling Tools, Data Warehousing (DW), Decision Making, Enterprise IT Architecture, Information Technology Consulting, Information Technology Trends, Multi-Level Communication, Physical Database Design

title: Senior Data Scientist - Insights
description:
Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 142 million registered learners as of December 31, 2023.

Coursera partners with over 325 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including courses, Specializations, Professional Certificates, Guided Projects, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in fields such as data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.

Join us in our mission to create a world where anyone, anywhere can transform their life through access to education. We're seeking talented individuals who share our passion and drive to revolutionize the way the world learns.

We at Coursera are committed to building a globally diverse team and are thrilled to extend employment opportunities to individuals in any country where we have a legal entity. We require candidates to possess eligible working rights and have a compatible timezone overlap with their team to facilitate seamless collaboration. As a remote-first company, our interviews and onboarding are entirely virtual, providing a smooth and efficient experience for our candidates.

Job Overview:

At Coursera, our Data Science team is helping to build the future of education through data-driven decision making and data-powered products. We drive product and business strategy through measurement, experimentation, and causal inference to help Coursera deliver effective content discovery and personalized learning at scale. We believe the next generation of teaching and learning should be personalized, accessible, and efficient. With our scale, data, technology, and talent, Coursera and its Data Science team are positioned to make that vision a reality.

We’re looking for a talented, creative, and collaborative data scientist to support decision-making for our product and business teams -- leveraging the rich data captured as over a hundred million learners and thousands of instructors engage on the platform to deliver innovative, data-driven insights on how to create experiences that will better meet the needs and expectations of learners. Our ideal candidate has excellent analysis and statistical modeling skills, strong written and verbal communication, and an interest in expanding the reach and quality of online education. In particular, the candidate should thrive as a product-oriented thinker who helps partner teams identify usage patterns and insights from massive datasets, quantify the most critical business opportunities, and measure impacts rigorously with experimentation.

Responsibilities:
• Develop our understanding of Coursera’s products, business, and learners by analyzing learner behavior to uncover patterns, define metrics of success, and identify opportunities for improvement
• Estimate the potential impact of proposed projects in order to inform partner teams’ prioritization decisions (e.g. what is the projected impact on graduation rates of providing career counseling)
• Perform predictive forecasting to quantify the impact of pricing and merchandising changes on long-term revenue.
• Create insightful presentations and actionable dashboards to help product decision-makers size opportunities and evaluate performance
• Work closely with data engineering and operations teams to ensure that new projects and products are launched with clear instrumentation to support experimentation and measurement plans
• Partner with other data scientists to develop evaluation strategies for novel AI models that facilitate teaching and learning at scale

Basic Qualifications:.
• Background in applied math, computer science, statistics, or a related technical field
• 4+ years of experience using data to advise product or business teams
• 2+ years of experience applying statistical inference techniques to business questions
• Excellent business intuition, cross-functional communication, and project management
• Proven track record of influencing to drive impact with data
• Strong applied statistics and data visualization skills
• Proficient with at least one scripting language (e.g. Python), one statistical software package (e.g. R, NumPy/SciPy/Pandas), and SQL

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience at EdTech or online consumer product business
• Experience partnering with product organizations
• Experience with data management and orchestration tools: Airflow, Databricks and/or dbt
• Experience with business intelligence tools (Amplitude, Looker)

If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:

Go Beyond the Numbers: Translate Data into Insights
Applied AI with DeepLearning
Probability & Statistics for Machine Learning & Data Science

#PL-1
Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.

For California Candidates, please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.

For our Global Candidates, please review our GDPR Recruitment Notice here.

title: Data Analytics Manager (12+ Month Contract)
description:
It’s more than a Career, it’s a Passion!

We love our cars, but it’s the people behind them who make them what they are. To build great cars, we need great people. That’s why Volkswagen Group Canada pays competitive salaries, offers fringe benefits, and provides unique opportunities for personal and professional growth. We encourage and reward initiative, creativity, teamwork and performance within a fast-paced, stimulating environment. And did we mention that there are really cool Volkswagen and Audi vehicles all over the place?

We are currently looking for a Data Analytics Manager (12+ Month Contract) at our Corporate Offices in Ajax, ON

As the Data Analytics Manager, you will play an integral role in ensuring Volkswagen Canada’s data strategy is effective and efficient to inform, streamline and steer business decisions. You will be responsible for leading and managing the Marketing Data Ecosystem at VW Canada. You will also play a key role in analyzing a wide range of data to help inform marketing, brand and business strategies.

Reporting to the Manager, CRM & Digital Marketing, your expertise in Marketing and Digital data (Web Analytics, CRM, and Digital Media and tagging), Market Research & Trends, Business and Sales data will be required to able to connect the overall data story. You will analyze large amounts of data to create distinct and informative storylines, leading to recommendations and insights. Additionally, this role will lead strategic business and marketing data initiatives and provide high quality data analysis as output. The outputs of these initiatives will help define effective go-to-market strategies, increase ROI and create accountability frameworks (with clear KPI targets) for internal and external partners.
• This is a hybrid flex model, based out of Ajax, ON**

Primary Responsibilities

Customer Insights & Measurement Strategy:
• Collaborate with key stakeholders, leading data analytics development and measurement. Define and deliver our customer insights approach, measurement strategies and reporting capabilities that ultimately drive efficiency
• Work with cross-functional teams (technical & non-technical) to develop consumer journey, and conversion strategies for existing customer and prospect groups. Identify opportunities throughout the consumer journey to increase acquisition, conversion and retention, which will help drive and influence digital advertising (targeting and audience creation), email, social media and website strategies.
• Help develop personalization and audience management strategy across the customer journey.

Data Analysis And Ongoing Customer Data Management
• Own the Omni-channel marketing data platforms. Working cross-functionally with all internal teams and agency partners for data management, data governance, and data strategy.
• Understand technical requirements for digital projects and lead end-to-end analytics implementation (data layer creation, tag deployment, testing, report building)
• Manage complex statistical projects such as Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM), Marketing Return on Investment Analysis (MROI) & Budget optimization analysis that drives ROI across all marketing channels.
• Be part of the team that helps define the Digital Marketing ecosystem/roadmap and delivers a marketing technology stack that is scalable, extendable, and uses 1st party customer data to enhance the consumer journey and drives brand and business growth. Work with key stakeholders to help define an integrated digital analytics and attribution approach.

Research, Reporting And Insights
• Manage research partner relationships to track brand, product and campaign tracking & performance to understand the effectiveness of overall marketing efforts.
• Implement forecasting models & establish a KPI framework to monitor marketing performance & efficiency.
• Support and develop reports & dashboards to measure data from various sources (including but not limited) to Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Tag Management, Datorama, Salesforce Marketing Cloud & Service Cloud, Salesforce Einstein, Tableau, Maritz mTab, Kantar KABGS reporting, DesRosiers reports, J.D. Power etc.

Qualifications
• Bachelor degree in Marketing, Business, Commerce, Data Management or similar fields and/or relevant work experience, with a quantitative focus. MBA is an asset.
• 4+ years of data analytics experience, or work experience as a Business, Data or Marketing Analyst (or similar roles)
• Previous experience working with digital analytics platforms (Google Marketing Platform, Adobe Marketing Platform); forecasting analysis and devising KPI frameworks to measure overall marketing effectiveness; and creating dashboards using Tableau, Data Studio, Datorama etc.
• Data management skills in a cloud, retail or e-commerce environment (insights/consulting)
• Strong data analytics expertise, including translating Marketing and business KPIs into actionable plans and strategies that drive growth and ROI
• Experience with data mining tools (e.g. SQL), visualization (e.g. Tableau, Datorama, Data Studio) and digital analytics tools (e.g. GA 360, Adobe Analytics)
• Strong understanding of how Digital & Technology industry trends are influencing data, customer analytics and the consumer journey
• Knowledge of data architecture & connected data strategy as it relates to databases, warehouses and data lakes (structured/unstructured data and relational/non-relational data)
• Knowledge of data as it pertains to Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, discovery and profiling
• Experience working with Data layer creation, Tag management solutions (GTM) and QA tools such as Omnibug, Adobe Debugger to support web applications, online tools and apps
• Proven track record in developing compelling business storylines and insights based on data trends and analysis
• Strong aptitude to analyze large volumes of data and devise conversion strategies and optimization plans
• Excellent communication, collaboration, and planning skills
• Outstanding team player and positive attitude, with a strong sense of ownership, accountability and the ability to partner with internal and external stakeholders

What You’ll Get In Return
• A flexible and collaborative team dynamic
• Opportunities for development
• Opportunities to participate in exciting company events that give back to the community
• Competitive employer paid benefits and overall compensation package
• And much more!

Interested applicants are asked to submit their application by March 29, 2024

Please note that we appreciate the interest of all candidates, however only those under consideration will be contacted.

Volkswagen Group Canada Inc. is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, family status, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by federal, or local laws.

Volkswagen Group Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities including during the application process. If you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to determine what reasonable accommodation may be available to meet your needs whether it be as an applicant or an employee. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance. If you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the Recruiter who will consult with you to determine an appropriate and reasonable accommodation

title: Bilingual Data Scientist
description:
Job Requisition ID: 10008

Position Status: Permanent Full Time

Position Type: Hybrid

Office Location: Montreal (QC); Calgary (AB); Halifax (NS); Ottawa (ON); Toronto (ON); Vancouver (BC)

Travel Requirement: Travel not required

Language Designation: Bilingual

Language Skill Levels (Read/Write/Speak): BBB

Salary: Our salaries generally range from $ 68974.7 to $ 86218.38 and are based on qualifications and experience.

About CMHC

At CMHC, the work you do and the work we do together matters. We come to work every day with a common purpose: to realize a future where everyone in Canada has a home that they can afford and meets their needs.

Our people are second to none. We lean in with courage, band together as a community and try new things to make a lasting impact on housing from coast to coast to coast.

Join us and be part of a team that's committed to making a real difference and be part of something meaningful.

What's in it for you

We've got the purpose, the people and the perks you need for a fulfilling career. Here's what you get when you're a permanent employee:
• 5 weeks of vacation.
• Annual individual performance bonus.
• Defined benefit pension plan.
• Comprehensive group insurance plan to support your well-being from day one.
• Support in your personal and professional growth with training, mentorship and more - because when you thrive, we thrive.
• An inclusive workplace culture and environment with Employee Resource Groups and more.
• A hybrid work model that lets you balance working from home and nurturing in-person connections by coming into your region's office at a minimum of 4 times a month.

About the role
Join the Analytics, Commercial Solutions team as a Bilingual Data Scientist. In this role, you will be responsible for utilizing analytical techniques to solve complex problems, to provide insights and to identify opportunities. In addition to analytic skills, this successful candidate is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets and communicating results to leadership and business teams.

What you'll do:
• Conduct data analysis and applies the appropriate algorithm to discover patterns.
• Develop and introduce new approaches to solving analytics problems.
• Research and experiment with various available technologies and tools while making recommendation on new methodologies, techniques or improvements leading to mature the analytical capability of CMHC.
• Work with the Senior Manager and teammates to support the maturity of the analytics capability by introducing analytics approaches (e.g. testing hypothesis, statistical validation, etc.).
• Support knowledge transfer sessions as well as the development of best practices.
• Assess large volumes of data and works towards integrating and preparing large and varied datasets for architecting the data.
• Responsible for modeling analytics problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, and mining techniques.

What you should have:
• A bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Physics or any other related quantitative field.
• A minimum of 3 years of work experience as a Data Scientist or similar position including a demonstrated proficiency integrating and preparing large, varied datasets and communicating results.
• Solid programming skills in open-source programming language (e.g. Python) or a statistical software package (e.g. R).
• Proficiency in conducting statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing and optimizing algorithms.
• Experience using a wide range of analytical techniques (e.g. supervised learning, clustering, natural language processing (NLP), time series analysis, A/B testing, regressions, correlations, statistical significance, network/link analysis, sentiment analysis).
• Bilingualism (English and French).

It would be great if you also had:
• Knowledge of the Insurance or Mortgage industry.

Posting closing date: Note, the competition will remain active until filled.

Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion

We're committed to employment equity and encourage women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, veterans and persons of all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientations, and gender identities and expressions to apply. We also welcome applications from non-Canadians who are eligible to work in Canada.

CMHC is an inclusive workplace where diversity of thought - and of people - are recognized, valued, and considered essential to achieving our mission.

Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion

What happens after you apply

We know that applying for a new job can be both exciting and daunting, and we appreciate your effort. Learn more about our hiring process. If you are selected for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

If you applied before and you were not successful don't worry - we're always posting new positions, so don't hesitate to give it another shot. We're excited to see what you bring to the table this time around

About Iris Software Inc.

With 4,000+ associates and offices in India, U.S.A. and Canada, Iris Software delivers technology services and solutions that help clients complete fast, far-reaching digital transformations and achieve their business goals. A strategic partner to Fortune 500 and other top companies in financial services and many other industries, Iris provides a value-driven approach - a unique blend of highly-skilled specialists, software engineering expertise, cutting-edge technology, and flexible engagement models. High customer satisfaction has translated into long-standing relationships and preferred-partner status with many of our clients, who rely on our 30+ years of technical and domain expertise to future-proof their enterprises. title: Analyst Data & Analytics
description:
Permanent Full Time

-

We are hiring an Analyst, Data & Analytics.

Our Global Strategy and Planning team is a strategic partner in our business – with an ambition to be a forward-thinking, agile technology organization delivering secure, resilient and leading solutions that support Canada Life and the well-being of millions of Canadians.

We are looking for an Analyst, Data & Analytics to create and deliver trusted metrics and dashboard reporting from our project and portfolio management tool to help teams and leaders improve technology delivery to meet business needs.

Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be in the following head office locations: London, Toronto, or Winnipeg. This is a fulltime permanent position.

What you wil do

Business Problem Analysis
• Identify and understand business problems and requirements related to project portfolio management (PPM), including portfolio health status, financial summaries, resource management, etc.
• Develop solutions, recommendations and plans to solve these problems with data analysis, metrics in dashboards, and reporting based on the data from our Broadcom Clarity PPM tool

Data Analysis
• Complete data analysis and discovery
• Build insights, better understand the data and the story it is telling to drive actionable results
• Collect, interpret, and analyze complex data sets
• Influence data quality through adherence to best practices in data collection and management; through collaboration with delivery teams to improve data collection processes
• Design, build and maintain user-friendly, interactive data visualizations and dashboards using complex datasets in Power BI for operational and management decision making
• Develop and implement metrics and performance indicators
• Apply and implement best practices to ensure dashboard design consistency, accuracy, and efficiency for the best user experience
• Design, write, debug, test, and fix analytics assets

Communication and Collaboration
• Collaborate daily with the core metrics, reporting and analytics team and delivery teams
• Share learnings with others across the company, including leadership, delivery teams and community of practice participation

What you will bring
• 3-5+ years of applied data management experience (Data modeling & analytics education an asset)
• Expertise in PowerBI, SharePoint, SQL
• Experience developing project portfolio management dashboards, preferably leveraging the Broadcom Clarity PPM data model
• Highly proficient in the core Microsoft Office applications
• Excellent communication and presentation skills and strong organization skills
• Proven learning ability and ability to manage multiple priorities in a challenging work environment
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Agile, practical, customer service-oriented mindset
• Generally curious and excited to learn new things

What will set you apart
• Experience working with and customizing Rego Consulting’s Power BI reports
• Experience developing Jaspersoft reports
• Experience developing portlets in Clarity PPM
• Experience with statistical analysis, and ability to write up written reports and summaries based on dashboards and analytics

-

The base salary for this position is between $51,400 - $95,200 annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.

Career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting, closing dates will vary depending on the search activity. All applications received will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today!

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.

Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations. 

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Canada Life policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact talentacquisitioncanada@canadalife.com.

Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

title: Master Data and Workflow Lead
description:
Job Information

Job Title: Master Data and Workflow Lead

Job Requisition ID: 55000

Ministry: Technology and Innovation

Location: Edmonton

Full or Part-Time: Full Time

Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week

Permanent/Temporary: Permanent

Scope: Open Competition

Closing Date: March 28, 2024

Classification: Program Services 4 (Market Adjustment)

Salary: $2,757.39 - $3,604.17 bi-weekly ($71,968 - $94,068 / Annually)

The Government of Alberta is committed to a diverse and inclusive public service that reflects the population we serve to best meet the needs of Albertans. Consider joining a team where diversity, inclusion and innovation are valued and supported. For more information on diversity and inclusion, please visit: https://www.alberta.ca/diversity-inclusion-policy.aspx

Within Technology and Innovation, the One Government Experience (1GX) Centre of Excellence (COE) branch provides transformational leadership to support and enable the shift to a One Government approach to corporate services across the Government of Alberta including the Independent Legislative Offices (ILO) through managing the implementation and ongoing operations of the enterprise resource planning system, 1GX. The success of 1GX enables the delivery of corporate services in a way that is flexible, accessible, economical, scalable, integrated, and relevant to the needs of the Alberta Public Service.

Within the 1GX COE branch, the Information and Business Excellence team has two key areas of responsibility. Information excellence ensures that the master data within 1GX is accurate to ensure that end users are working with the correct information. Business excellence support the user adoption of 1GX through change management and training.

The passionate and solutions focused people that we hire help us to drive vital programs and services that affect Albertans. Whatever your position is here, you will be a part of something great. Join us!

To learn more about us, please visit: https://www.alberta.ca/technology-and-innovation

Role Responsibilities

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a discerning eye for accuracy, a passion for delivering top-notch client service, and the ability to thrive in an analytical environment? Are you ready to meet big challenges and learn more about how government operates?

1GX must have accurate and timely master data for all three functional streams. Master data is the base for all the functionality of the system and ensures that workflows for processing transactions work as designed. We know we need a team who can critically question, evaluate, design and test master data so that users have what they need when they need it.

Reporting to the Manager, Information Excellence, you will lead a team of dedicated professionals who are passionate about data quality and integrity. Working collaboratively with the larger 1GX Center of Excellence team, you will lead and/or support upgrades, maintenance, enhancements and new functionality throughout the design, development, testing, implementation, and post-implementation phases. You also will work with clients across government to help understand how the master data and workflows work in an integrated solution. Using your creative and technical skills for looking at issues, you will identify and analyze the data to drive innovative solutions for issues or improvements.

As the MDM and Workflow Lead, you use your creative skills to develop solutions that are innovative and effective. Your data analysis expertise is superb, and you are constantly looking to improve how data can be used to support improvements to 1GX and business processes. You take great pride in developing processes to ensure that data integrity is at the forefront. In addition, you have exemplary customer service skills to help users across government with inquiries.

Do you enjoy work that is non-routine, fluid and unpredictable? Are you focused on creating value and driving results? Do you enjoy tackling important challenges with a team of diverse people with diverse perspectives?

If you said yes, then come join us at the Government of Alberta!

To be Successful in this position you will demonstrate:
• Expertise in data compliance methodologies and considerations.
• Expertise in collaborating on cross-functional teams to meet critical, time-sensitive deadlines and communicating to diverse audiences.
• Strong research, analytical and interpretive abilities to provide sound advice, interpretation, and guidance on the application of the 1GX programs.
• Excellent interpersonal skills including active listening, written and verbal communication, and conflict management.
• Strong attention to detail and accuracy; exercise tact and discretion.

APS Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.

The link below will assist you with understanding competencies:

https://www.alberta.ca/assets/documents/psc-alberta-public-service-competency-model.pdf

Agility: you will work in a fast paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities. Identifies alternative approaches and anticipates obstacles and stays focused on goals. and support others to do the same.

Drive for Results: you will have the ability to quickly understand an issue based on and present knowledge and experience and follows through until the issue is resolved.

Develop Self and Others: you will develop self and others –Identifies learning and knowledge-sharing opportunities and willingly shares knowledge with others.

Build Collaborative Environments: fostering collaboration across functional areas, proactively resolving conflicts, promoting innovative thinking on projects, removing obstacles to progress, facilitating seamless communication and collaboration, preemptively addressing and mitigating conflicts, and ensuring due recognition for talented individuals.

Develop Networks: you will seek out input from a wide range of internal and external stakeholders to solve complex problems and provide the best solutions.

Systems Thinking: Takes a long-term view towards organization’s objectives and achieving them

Qualifications

Required:
• University graduation in a related field such as Business Administration, Commerce, Computer Sciences, Finance, Information Technology.
• Four (4) years progressively responsible related experience working with ERP Applications and data and interactions between various modules and components of the applications (e.g., HR, Payroll, Finance, HCM)
• Supervisory/Leadership experience with the ability to inspire and guide a team, with:

- Collaborative mindset, a positive attitude, and an ability to thrive within our dynamic team-oriented culture.

- Expertise to examine challenging problems, with an emphasis on problem-solving abilities and the capability to suggest potential solutions or outcomes.

Equivalency: Directly related education or experience considered based on
• 1 year of education for 1 year of experience; or
• 1 year of experience for 1 year of education.

Assets:
• Experience in project planning and management methodologies and best practices, including those related to planning, project management, resource management, risk analysis, and controls.
• Experience in change and issues management, progress monitoring and reporting.
• Experience in both HCM and Finance.
• Experience in leading teams doing Master data (e.g., cost centers, position management, workflows, data analytics).
• Knowledge and understanding of the department’s business plan and objectives.
• Experience working with ERP applications and data, similar to 1GX applications and data and the interaction between various modules and components of applications (e.g., HCM, Payroll SCM, Finance).
• Ability to analyze complex issues, including problem solving skills and ability to provide possible outcomes or solutions.
• Well-developed organizational and time management skills to work independently and in a team setting.

Notes

Term of Employment: Permanent full-time position

Hours of Work: 36.25/week, Monday- Friday

Location: The position is located at Terrace Building, 9515 107 Street, NW, Edmonton, AB T5K 2C1.

Final candidates will be required to undergo a security screening.

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies, across the Government of Alberta, at the same or lower classification level.

Applicants are advised to provide a cover letter summarizing information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience, and relevant examples of required competencies.

Additional Information:

In your resume, please include dates (including months and years) associated with all education and work experience. As well, please indicate whether your work experience is casual, part-time, or full-time. For example, January 15, 2006 - June 25, 2009: Assistant (PT three 8 hrs. shifts/week).

Any costs associated with obtaining the required documents/checks as noted or interview travel expenses, will be the responsibility of the candidate. Out-of-province applicants can obtain the required documents/checks from the province they currently reside in.

Links and information on what the GoA has to offer to prospective employees.
• Working for the Alberta Public Service – https://www.alberta.ca/advantages- working-for-alberta-public-service.aspx
• Pension plans: Public Service Pension Plan (PSPP) – https://www.pspp.ca

Management Employees Pension Plan (MEPP) – https://www.mepp.ca
• Alberta Public Service Benefit Information – https://www.alberta.ca/alberta-public-service-benefits
• Leadership and mentorship programs
• Professional learning and development - https://www.alberta.ca/alberta-public-service-human-resource-directives
• Positive workplace culture and work-life balance
• Opportunity to participate in flexible work arrangements such as working from home up to two days per week and modified work schedule agreement.
• Research Alberta Public Service Careers tool - https://researchapscareers.alberta.ca

How To Apply

Applicants are advised to provide information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience, and relevant examples of required competencies.

Candidates are required to apply for a job online. Please visit https://www.alberta.ca/job-application-resources#before for more information. Please visit Recruitment Principles, for more information.

It is recommended applicants who have completed post-secondary studies from outside of Canada obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS)(https://www.alberta.ca/international-qualifications-assessment.aspx) or from a recognized Canadian Credential Evaluator; please visit the Alliance of Credential Evaluation Services of Canada for more information (https://canalliance.org/en/default.html).

It is recommended that applicants include the assessment certificate from IQAS or any other educational assessment service as part of their application.

Closing Statement

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies, across the Government of Alberta, at the same or lower classification level.

We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

If you require any further information on this job posting or a copy of the role profile, please contact Michelle Elliott at Michelle.Elliott@gov.ab.ca

title: Director, Data Science & Innovation
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As the Director, Data Science & Innovation, you will lead a team of highly skilled and experienced data science and analytic professionals with interdisciplinary knowledge ranging from computer science, mathematics, econometrics, and statistics. You will also be responsible for identifying, developing and implementing advanced data science and analytics solutions to solve complex business problems that contribute to improved profitability, cost reduction and process optimization across all Insurance platforms including: Digital, Operations, Sales, Strategy, Pricing, Underwriting and Product. Leveraging leading edge technologies and capabilities, the team applies traditional artificial intelligence and generative AI techniques to help RBC Insurance solve complex business problems, understand the changing business environment, discover new growth opportunities, and determine where business improvements can be made.

What will you do?
• Lead strategy development relating to the provision of statistical methodology, use and implementation
• Owns and manages the RBCI GenAI and Traditional AI product strategy, roadmap and implementation, including the management of AI product squads
• Develop and manage a robust suite of predictive modeling tools and a decision support framework to drive insurance performance and profitability
• Autonomously advise the RBCI leadership team on methods and use cases of applied statistics and data science as it relates to RBCI strategic goals and priorities
• Assess and quantify financial and business value of data science initiatives, in partnership with the business
• Responsible for Data Science research + innovation, including the development of new cutting-edge capabilities
• Proactively identify opportunities to leverage AI, predictive modeling and analytics solutions within Insurance
• Coach, train and mentor data science professionals
• Provides guidance, support and oversight to team relating to data science end-to-end process and execution
• Build out and scale Data Science team core competencies to support Data Science growth within Insurance
• Own the delivery of model validation and model performance tracking

Here’s what we need from you:

Must-have
• 5+ years experience developing machine learning and AI models to solve complex business problems
• 3+ years people management experience
• Strong problem solving, analytics and critical thinking mindset
• AI product management experience, including leading cross-functional teams
• Proficient in relevant statistical tools including R, Python, SAS/STAT and SAS/Enterprise Miner
• Solid knowledge of various database environments including Cloud technologies, SQL, Data Lake House (i.e. Snowflake)
• Experience with Generative AI and Large Language Models technology (i.e. GPT 3.5/4.0, BERT, Falcon, LLaMA)
• Familiar with ML ops orchestration tools (i.e. Openshift)

Nice to Have
• Insurance industry experience
• Experience working in an agile environment
• Strong relationship management
• Change management

What’s in it for you?
• A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans
• Competitive pay and high-earning potential
• All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your business and career
• Flexible work/life balance options
• Sophisticated RBCI software tools to boost your productivity and grow your business

RBC Insurance is an organization that succeeds by bringing out the best in its people. You’ll be part of a supportive, inclusive team that shares common values – including a fundamental respect for each other. At the heart of this is a commitment to diversity. RBC respects and responds to the many competing and evolving priorities in our lives – so you can focus on what you can do best – putting clients first.

Job Skills
Artificial Intelligence (AI), Big Data Management, Data Mining, Data Science, Decision Making, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Predictive Analytics, Python (Programming Language), Statistical Analysis

Additional Job Details

Address:

MEADOWVALE BUSINESS PARK, 6880 FINANCIAL DR:MISSISSAUGA

City:

MISSISSAUGA

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

INSURANCE

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2024-03-12

Application Deadline:

2024-03-26

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com

title: People Operations Specialist, Data Analytics
description:
People Operations Specialist, Data Analytics

SoundHound’s independent voice AI platform connects people to brands through customized conversational experiences that voice-enable products, services, and apps while giving companies access to their valuable data and analytics for greater control and brand ownership of the customer experience.

Company Operating Name: Soundhound

Company Legal Name: SoundHound Canada Inc.

Business Address: 2 Bloor Street East, Suite 2010, Toronto, ON M4W 1A8

Location of Work: 2 Bloor Street East, Suite 2010,Toronto, ON M4W 1A8

Job Title: People Operations Specialist

Terms of Employment: Full-time, Permanent, 40 hours a week, Salaried

Language: English

Compensation: $75,005 - $85,000 CAD

Benefits:
• Life insurance and Accidental Death and Dismemberment
• Long-Term Disability
• Extended Health Care
• Dental
• Vision
• Spring Health (mental health services)

Duties and Responsibilities:

Data and Analytics / System Administration
• Support all employee data-related tasks while ensuring the highest level of data integrity, confidentiality, and security
• Ensure our HR Systems are up-to-date and accurate, including ongoing updates to titles, compensation, and other employment data
• Provide advanced reporting and analytics from HR system to Finance, Legal, Executive Leadership and other departments
• Create, manage, update critical People and Culture dashboard using Looker Studio (formerly Google Data studio), troubleshoot when issues arise
• Build and maintain reports in UKG Pro People Analytics
• System administer for UKG Ready/Workforce Management including advanced reporting, troubleshooting, and configuration corrections
• Perform detailed audits of HR Systems
• Provide data for annual EEO reporting
• Leverage Advanced understanding of Google sheets and excel formulas (xlookup, vlookup, DIF, etc.)

General HR
• Administer New Hire Orientation and facilitate onboarding tasks for all employees, including Canadian, US, and Global offices
• Perform Employment Verifications via Experian
• Administer 401k updates for US employees (strong attention to detail, high level of accuracy, limited mistakes)
• Administer RRSP updates for Canadian employees
• Respond to day-to-day inquiries and serve as the first point of contact for employees to address and resolve their requests and concerns in areas such as benefits, HR systems, and employment verification
• Respond to employee benefit inquiries, help with open enrollment, and manage leave of absence processes, working closely with employees and 3rd party providers
• Provide advice, assistance, and follow-up on company policies, procedures, and documentation
• Guide employees through our established processes for things like promotions, salary changes, and updating employment data
• Recommend process improvements, identify issues, and make suggestions as appropriate
• Contribute to company-wide initiatives related to operations, security, and compliance (e.g., performance reviews, required trainings)
• Facilitate implementation of new employee training, development, recruiting, and other related initiatives
• Ability to multitask and pivot to address changing priorities of the team
• Self-driven, initiative to complete assigned tasks, audit information, make corrections, etc. to keep the HR tasks and priorities running smoothly
• Conduct exit interviews and process all tasks related to off-boarding
• Customer focused approach to Human Resources, providing all stakeholders with empathetic, clear communication
• Strong listening skills, ability to understand and respond to the needs of others
• Expected to convey information (written and verbal) effectively and accurately to employees and 3rd parties
• Collaborate effectively with others and contribute positively to group goals
• Ability to adjust to changing circumstances and embrace challenges with ease
• Maintain optimism and enthusiasm when faced with unfamiliar tasks or changing priorities

Job Requirements:
• Minimum Education:
• * Bachelor's degree in Human Resources or equivalent
• Certification in Human Resource Management or equivalent
• Work Experience:
• * Minimum of 3 years of related, full-time experience
• Experience Supporting Global Employee base (ie. Europe, Asia, US)
• UKG and Payworks administrative experience
• * UKG Ready
• Reporting
• Minimum of 2 years experience with Microsoft Suite or equivalent
• Minimum of 2 years experience with Google Workspace or equivalent
• Office attendance
• * Minimum of 1 day a week in office

To apply for this opportunity, please forward your resume to apply@soundhound.com. We thank all applicants however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

About the Company:
SoundHound Canada Inc

title: Junior Data Entry Assistant (Remote)
description:
Only accepting applicants here: seekmate.net

Our Data Entry team is expanding, and we're in search of dedicated individuals who can support a broad spectrum of projects, from healthcare research endeavors to the refinement of e-commerce platforms and customer feedback analysis.

The Data Entry roles we offer are highly flexible, giving you the option to work remotely, an excellent way to earn additional income from any preferred location, or to choose the engaging atmosphere of our office settings for those who prefer traditional workspaces.

Roles And Responsibilities
• Log into your designated workstation, whether online or onsite, 10 minutes before your shift, to start on time.
• Ensure the accuracy of data entry, following the project-specific guidelines meticulously, whether the instructions are provided in writing or orally.
• Address the particular data entry requirements of each project, which may include tasks such as organizing and inputting data related to products or services following an initial review.
• Maintain the data accuracy levels demanded by each project.

Desired Skills
• A computer or smartphone with a reliable camera is required.
• An uninterrupted, high-speed internet connection is essential.
• Proficiency in accurately following detailed instructions.
• Previous experience in data entry, while not mandatory, is highly valued.

Employee Benefits
• The choice between remote work and on-site work, depending on your personal preference.
• Remote work offers the advantage of eliminating commute times and costs.
• Flexible work hours to suit your availability, whether looking for full-time or part-time employment.
• Access to new product samples for specific projects, providing valuable hands-on experience with the latest innovations.
• The opportunity to provide early feedback on new products or services before they are released to the general public.

This is a part-time, remote position ideal for individuals looking for flexible, temporary employment opportunities from their home. Prior experience in data curation is not necessary, offering a fantastic avenue for earning additional income through flexible remote tasks.

Important: This role is intended for earning supplemental income and is not a full-time job opportunity

title: Data Solution Architect
description:
We are a growing company looking for a highly motivated Data Solutions Architect to lead the development of our data solutions platform. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work with a dynamic group of professionals dedicated to delivering innovative solutions for our clients.

YOU’LL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO:
• Develop and maintain data architecture and roadmaps for our data solutions platform.
• Work closely with domain leads to understand business requirements, translate them into effective data solutions, and lead the integration of new data sources into the platform ensuring data accuracy and quality.
• Design, develop and maintain data modeling guidelines, working closely with business analysts, data governance team, data architects and data engineers to ensure secure, scalable, and compliant solutions that meet industry standards and laws such as GDPR and SOX.
• Lead the integration of new data sources into the platform and ensure the quality and accuracy of the data.
• Continuously evaluate and improve the platform architecture, from source data capture to the presentation layer, ensuring effective integration with other enterprise systems.
• Collaborate with other technology teams to ensure the effective integration of our data solutions with other enterprise systems.
• Guide and mentor a team of data engineers and domain data architects to ensure the development and maintenance of high-quality data solutions, utilizing strong communication, interpersonal, leadership and mentoring skills to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

YOU’LL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES:
• Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
• 7+ years of experience in data architecture, data engineering, or related field.
• Experience with cloud-based data solutions such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
• Experience with ETL tools and data integration techniques.
• Knowledge of data governance and data security best practices.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
• Strong leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to lead and inspire a team.
• Highly motivated to work in an open team environment, employing a collaborative, continuous improvement, and innovation mindset.

STAND OUT WITH...
• Demonstrated experience leading the development of large-scale data solutions that meet the needs of the business and align with corporate objectives.
• Familiarity with cloud solutions and implementations, such as AWS, Azure, Snowflake, Databricks, etc.
• Good understanding of Business Intelligence tools, such as PowerBI, Tableau, etc.
• Solid understanding of data governance principles and best practices.

ACKNOWLEDGING THE POWER OF DIVERSITY

BRP is dedicated to nurturing a culture that invites, connects, and propels the ambitions of people of all backgrounds, profiles, beliefs and experiences. Ultimately, the diversity and uniqueness of our people fuel our ingenuity and set the course for the path ahead!

For this reason, we value diversity and we strive to always push each other forward to build an inclusive workplace where every employee feels like they belong, where they can grow and find meaning.

AT BRP, WHEN WE TALK ABOUT BENEFITS, WE GO ALL IN.

Let’s start with a strong foundation — You want it, we have it:
• Annual bonus: we work hard, and we know it. This yearly thank you is our way to fuel your dreams.
• Generous paid time away: winding down is as important as creating the future of recreational products.
• Pension plan: we want to make sure you’ll enjoy retirement; we’ve got you covered.
• Collective saving opportunities: being part of BRP allows you to tap into the strength of our saving programs.
• Industry leading healthcare: fully paid by BRP, this program is here for you, whatever happens, so you can focus on what matters.

What about some feel good extras:
• Flexible work schedule: balance is key to innovation, and we want to make sure you are at the top of your game with a schedule that will work for you.
• Summer schedule: time flies at BRP, so we hit pause to enjoy it.
• Holiday season shutdown: between Christmas and New Year’s, we close our facilities and refill on good times.
• Educational resources: you love what you do, and we get you resources to stay cutting-edge, so we all win together.
• Discount on BRP products: what we build is amazing, freeing, revolutionary, and you're first in line for the experience.

WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 23,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey.
