title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning/AI Specialist
description:
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

In your role, you will

• Act as the lead of a team of data scientist, data engineer and university interns

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business problems and opportunities that can be addressed through machine learning solutions.

• Design, develop and implement artificial intelligence models using tools such as PyTorch, Kedro, and Scikit-learn.

• Automate data extraction and transformation for the AI/ML pipelines.

• Deploy and integrate/adapt existing and new machine learning models into the SAP4Hana platform using SAP Hana Cloud Platform or SAP Cloud Platform.

• Evaluate the performance of machine learning models through test to assess the impact and fine-tune them to improve accuracy and efficiency.

• Develop and maintain documentation, best practices, and guidelines for machine learning implementation in SAP4Hana.

• Keep up to date with the latest research and trends in the field of Machine Learning and SAP4Hana, and apply new methods and techniques where appropriate.

Job Overview: We are seeking a talented and experienced Machine Learning/AI Specialist to join aftermarket planning & forecasting team and work on the development and implementation of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning solutions for optimization on various aftermarket processes such as inventory management, demand forecasting, supply chain management. You will be responsible for analyzing data, designing and implementing machine learning models, and integrating them into our various transactional platform to improve workflow efficiency using automation, business processes and optimize decision-making.

As our ideal candidate
• You have a Master's degree in data science & business analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
• You have at least 5 years of experience in developing and deploying machine learning models.
• You have strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms, statistical modeling, and data analysis techniques.
• You have hands-on experience with programming languages such as:
• Python : Pandas, Kedro, Scikit-learn,lgbm, R: dplyr, time series forecasting
• SQL: : Experience with complex queries
• You have experience with Reinforcement Learning and Mathematical Optimization is a plus
• You have experience in development using cloud providers Azure (Databricks. Synapse) and AWS (Codebuild, Elastic Contained service)
• You have excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
• You speak and write in French and English
• You are autonomous and resourceful spirit
• You have strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

Your ideas move people.

Organization Aerospace Canada

Job Summary

The Data Exploitation Analysts (DEA) conduct research, analysis, and exploits data using advanced analytical tools and techniques to produce reports and intelligence in support of the Service investigations and operations. The DEA’s work on new analytical processes and identify technical enhancements to improve capabilities and tools.

Major Responsibilities:
• Consult with clients to determine their requirements for data analysis, understand their intelligence question(s), and in non-technical language advise on appropriate analytical approaches.
• Assess, analyze, exploit and interpret data; bringing to bear general and specialized knowledge and communicating the results through reports and other products. Thus further advancing investigations.
• Be familiar with and ensure program area activities are compliant with relevant legislation, policies, and ministerial requirements.
• Develop and maintain knowledge of analytical tradecraft, methodologies, and techniques, as well as advanced tools, systems and data sources.
• Work with other DEAs to identify innovative/creative solutions to enhance existing analytical processes, products, technical capabilities, and data literacy.
• Contribute to data analytics policy development and training.

Education
• Undergraduate degree and four (4) years of experience *
• College diploma and five (5) years of experience *

The educational program must be from an accredited learning institution recognized in Canada.

If you completed a program outside of Canada you will be required to obtain proof of a Canadian equivalency at your expense through a recognized credential assessment service.

Note: Any higher level of education could be recognized as experience.

Experience
• Experience1 with the use of analytical tools and interpret data to inform decision-making.

Candidates must also possess:
• Two (2) years providing written and verbal advice (formal or informal) to assist colleagues / clients / managers in making the best decisions to meet their particular requirements.
• Two (2) years experience organizing and exploiting data to create analytical products
• Experience in analysing and conveying complex2 information in plain language to a non-technical audience

1 The breadth and depth of sought experience involve files of various complexities, multiple issues, partners or clients, impacts or risks.

2 For the purpose of this career opportunity, complex information can be considered to be about any of the following: finance, data, systems, software, technology, applications, statistics, geospatial, imagery, biometric, crime, military, national security, or other related fields.

Assets: An asset qualification is a qualification which can enhance the ability to perform the work based on current and future business requirements, but which is not strictly required. Assets can help determine right fit.

Data Exploitation Analyst
• Experience in the use of data visualization software (i.e., Tableau, Power BI, or SISENSE).
• Experience conducting analysis with Microsoft Excel or financial analysis software using complex formulas, PivotTables, other built-in analysis tools, macros, or VBA.
• Experience supporting law enforcement or security investigations.
• Proficiency in the use of programming languages such as Python.
• An undergraduate degree or higher level of education in a field of study related to Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Demographics, Social Sciences, or other Science, Technology, Mathematics, Geography, Geographic Information Systems, or Geomatics.

Financial Data Exploitation Analyst (FININT)
• An undergraduate degree or higher level of education in a field of study related to Accounting, Business Administration, Commerce, Economics, Finance or other financial topics.
• Achievement of, or progress towards, a recognized financial designation such as: Charted Professional Accountant (CPA), Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) or, Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE).
• Experience in the analysis or exploitation of financial data.
• Experience interpreting details of financial transactions to understand the action/behaviour that generated a transaction, analyzing financial activity for trends or patterns, or performing computations on financial data in order to derive conclusions.
• Understanding of the PCMLTFA, Bank Act, PIPEDA, SCIDA, or the Income Tax Act.
• Understanding of law, regulations, and policies governing national security activities including lawful access programs, data programs, and privacy requirements

Competencies
• Problem solving
• Analytical Skills
• Innovation/Creativity/Ingenuity
• Communication Skills
• Behavioural Flexibility
• Team work

Conditions of Employment

Not Applicable

Notes

While we continue to explore opportunities for flexible work arrangements, the majority of work in our organization must be done in the office and cannot be performed at home.

A competency-based interview, a written exam and reference check may be administered to retained applicants. To know more about our process, please visit: Job Requirements- Canada.ca

Candidates should note that non-imperative staffing may be considered in situations where it can contribute to closing representation gaps in employment equity groups.

Screening Exam

Written exams will be administered as part of this competitive process. If successful, you will be invited to an interview. The exams will serve to evaluate your knowledge, skills and experience as it relates to the position.

Competency-Based Interview

The Competency-Based Interview will assess the candidate’s experience, knowledge, and competencies listed in this tabloid.

Reference checks may be conducted as part of the assessment process.

While we continue to explore opportunities for flexible work arrangements, the majority of work in our organization must be done in the office and cannot be performed at home.
• Security Requirements

Candidates must be eligible to receive an Enhanced Top Secret security clearance. The process involves a security interview, a polygraph, and a background investigation that includes credit and financial verifications. The use of illegal drugs is a criminal offense. Drug use is an important factor considered in your reliability and suitability assessment during the selection process. Therefore it is important not to use any illegal drugs from the time you submit your application.

Others

Important

Applicants must clearly demonstrate in their application how they meet each Education and Experience criteria. Failure to do so will result in the applicant being screened out of the career opportunity.

CSIS is a separate employer and is not subject to the Public Service Employment Act (PSEA). CSIS has its own classification, compensation system, and a different staffing regime. As such, we use a different staffing process and terminology.

This will be achieved by increasing employment equity group representation (including persons with disabilities, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, and women) at all levels within the organization through hiring and talent management practices. We will also ensure that appropriate accommodations are made (e.g., specialized equipment, changes to physical workspace) to provide employment opportunities for all qualified candidates. In support of achieving a greater, diverse and skilled workforce, we strongly encourage those individuals who belong to one or more of the employment equity groups to self-identify when applying.

Should you require accommodation in relation to a disability, please tell us at the beginning of the selection process. This information will be kept confidential.

CSIS Offices in Canada are located on various ancestral and traditional lands. In the spirit of reconciliation, we acknowledge all Indigenous People across Canada and their connection to these lands.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Data Governance Office (DGO) at RBC Global Asset Management (GAM) is accountable for implementing and maintaining GAM’s Data Management Program. The DGO has authority over the governance of all information at GAM and the obligation to create and enforce standards, set rules and establish policies on data creation, integration, and consumption.

In your role as Data Analyst, you’ll be performing data driven business analysis, data maintenance and management process of complex data flows. You will also contribute to data policies development and provide consistent improvement of data quality and transparency. For more information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com/en/ca/

What will you do?
• Maintain and enrich RBC Global Asset Management’s data warehouse working with all of RBC Global Asset Management’s investment groups. This would include security classification, analytics and reference data.
• Work in conjunction with team members to ensure data standards are defined and enforced
• Collaborate with internal clients to identify, document and source data
• Support short to midterm project implementations
• Document business and technical processes
• Develop toolsets and methods to improve data quality and availability
• Other duties and responsibilities as assigned

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have
• Demonstrated ability to understand data relationships, aggregate information and utilize SQL or other querying languages to research data issues
• Experience verifying security data using sources such as Bloomberg, Yield Book, Factset, Ratings Agencies, and/or others
• Operational understanding of fixed income, equity and derivative securities
• Ability to translate business requirements into data requirements
• Detail-oriented with strong analytical skills and ability to work under pressure to deliver within time-sensitive deadlines

Nice to Have
• Investment operations, compliance or back-office experience
• Ability to set priorities and work effectively in a fast paced, deadline oriented environment. Strong follow-through skills
• Ability to be able to think creatively and use ‘out of the box’ solutions where possible.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
• A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
• Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
• Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
• Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
• Opportunities to do challenging work
• Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Skills
Critical Thinking, Data Administration, Database Structures, Data Modeling, Data Movement, Detail-Oriented, Group Problem Solving, Information Capture, Standard Operating Procedure (SOP), Teamwork

At PwC, we embrace new technology where you will learn to innovate and deliver differently. To learn about our application process visit our Applying to PwC page on our campus recruitment website.

To apply, visit our campus recruitment website at pwc.com/ca/campus and submit your resume and transcripts (unofficial version is accepted) by March 31st, 2024 at 11:59 PM EST.

Join our community of solvers in cultivating a collaborative workplace driven by unique perspectives. We’re proud PwC Canada advances a culture that helps everyone thrive. It's one of the reasons we're recognized as a top employer in Canada. As you build a career with purpose and build meaningful connections that’ll last a lifetime, you'll work with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to help solve important problems, powered by the latest technology, to turn today's ideas into tomorrow's solutions.

PwC Canada is committed to cultivating an inclusive, hybrid work environment - one that is collaborative, supportive and productive. We work in-person and virtually, as is best suited for our clients, teams and people. We want you to be intentional with your work, how you do it and where it’s done. PwC offices are hubs of connectivity and learning. We strongly encourage our people to prioritize in-person work, whether it’s in the office or at a client site. This means we expect you to be in-person (either with clients or in the office) at least half of your time.

We know that hybrid work is all about balance, and capturing the benefits of in-person work is essential to your growth at the firm. Exact expectations for your team can be discussed with your interviewer.

What you’ll create and do

Risk and regulatory requirements have never been higher on the boardroom agenda. Our Risk Assurance professionals help organizations effectively manage their risks and increasingly complex regulatory requirements. We help clients demonstrate that, whatever the threat, there's a plan in place to deal with and mitigate that risk.

As a Co-op or Winter Intern in our Accelerate program you will gain exposure to the following areas within Risk Assurance Services:
• Assurance Development: Redefine how PwC performs its assurance services by building a strong understanding of commonly used client information systems (ERPs) to develop automated solutions to problems encountered by existing engagement teams.
• Specialised Assurance: Engage with clients in highly specialised assurance tasks, using advanced data analysis and automation to deliver results. Includes testing of key client reports, testing over client's ERP system conversions and developing solutions for industry specific assurance.
• Data Analysis: Help clients manage their data better and feel confident that the information generated from their business data is reliable and can help them make the right business decisions.
• Acquire Data: Work with clients to understand and set up and optimize the process to acquire comprehensive datasets used as the foundation of PwC's audits. This includes implementing the cutting edge technology (such as PwC Extract) for data extraction and transformation to facilitate end to end automation.

With connectivity being a key enabler of our strategy, our objective is to become the most connected firm - connected to our clients, our communities and to each other. PwC follows an Activity Based Work model, where our PwC professionals engage in a diverse range of activities from our offices, from client sites, or our home.

What you’ll bring to this role:
• Enrolled in post-secondary education
• An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work
• A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and working alongside diverse people and perspectives
• Strong written and verbal communication skills to articulate new ideas
• Highly detail oriented with excellent organizational and analytical skills; an ability to think broadly and to ask questions about data, facts and other information to deliver quality to our clients
• Share and collaborate effectively with others, building relationships which are genuine and rooted in trust
• Ability to easily adapt and prioritize, demonstrating project management skills to handle changing priorities
• Examples of alignment with PwC Values: Acting with Integrity, Working Together, Care, Reimagine the Possible and Make a Difference
• You’ll be comfortable travelling to cities across Canada (when deemed safe to do so by applicable public health or regulatory authorities and PwC)
• This role requires that you are legally entitled to work for PwC in Canada for the intended duration of the offer/contract.
• Excellente maîtrise du français exigée

Note: We only allow you to submit one application; however you are able to select a second and third office preference.

Why you’ll love working with us

At PwC Canada, our solvers are supported through meaningful rewards, meaningful connections, meaningful work, and meaningful growth. Thrive in work and life through our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture, powered by the latest tech. Learn what it means to be a part of The New Equation.

Please note: eligibility for some of these benefits is dependent on the role

Find out what it takes to be a part of The New Equation.

At PwC Canada, our most valuable asset is our people and we grow stronger as we learn from one another. We’re committed to creating an equitable and inclusive community of solvers where everyone feels that they truly belong. We understand that experience comes in many forms and building trust in society and solving important problems is only possible if we reflect the mosaic of the society we live in.

title: Engineer In Training Image Data Analytics
description:
Canadian Pacific (CP) and Kansas City Southern (KCS) are now CPKC. As the only truly North American railway, we are making big moves! Drawing on our strong foundations and heritage, CPKC moves essential goods across our 20,000-mile network to support economic growth throughout Canada, the U.S. and Mexico. Be a part of history as we connect a continent and create exciting career opportunities across our new transnational network. Visit cpkcr.com to learn about the CPKC advantage, our purpose and culture.

PURPOSE OF THE POSITION:

The Image Data Analytics EIT performs mechanical and image data analysis in support of requests from the mechanical car and locomotive, safety and regulatory, and engineering departments. Data analytics performed by the employee are used to identify mechanical safety defects for locomotive and railcar assets. They will also be used to determine root causes for a number of events occurring in railway operations which consist of, but are not limited to, the following: derailments, component failures in linear, locomotive, and railcar assets. The position will be responsible to drive and develop computer vision initiatives including machine vision algorithms to identify the state of railway equipment. The results of these analyses may also be used to enhance Equipment Health Monitoring System (EHMS) rules or to purchase preventative technologies to improve safety, increase operational efficiency, and assist in asset repair management strategies. Determining more efficient ways for extracting and consolidating data is also a responsibility of the employee to facilitate both internal requests and those from regulatory bodies such as Transport Canada, the Transportation Safety Board, the Federal Railroad Association (FRA), and the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB).

POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:
• Support all mechanical, safety and regulatory, and engineering department investigations
• Develop new business and operating rules based on image data analysis key findings and root causes
• Develop and produce machine vision algorithms to identify mechanical and safety defects on railway equipment on a regular schedule
• Support business case developments for new technology purchases and/or process integrations based on data analysis results to improve railway safety and efficiency
• Coordinate the implementation and installation of such technologies
• Propose new processes and technologies to enhance investigation data retrieval and processing capabilities to increase productivity
• Define requirements and work with IT staff to incorporate all technological changes
• Utilize vast quantities of wayside detector, locomotive, operating, repair, and incident data sources to develop value adding machine learning models and processes
• Visit train yards and derailment sites as required to collect evidence and data immediately as incidents occur
• Adhere to Canadian Pacific’s health and safety policy
• Support occasional weekend requests for immediate analysis

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
• Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or computer science from an accredited college or university
• Eligible to register as an EIT or hold a P.Eng. status
• Minimum 3 years’ experience implementing data mining and machine learning concepts OR evidence of project work in school in artificial intelligence fields
• Development experience using programming languages such as Python, R, Java, C++, SQL
• Experience with AWS and/or other cloud providers
• Experience with applying machine learning modelling to image data
• Ability to write clear and concise reports which will be distributed to high level management
• Must possess a valid Class 5 driver’s permit
• Valid passport, ability to travel to US/CAN without restrictions

WHAT CPKC HAS TO OFFER:
• Flexible and competitive benefits package
• Competitive company pension plan
• Employee Share Purchase Plan
• Performance Incentive Program
• Annual Fitness Subsidy
• Part-time Studies Program

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

As an employer with North American presence, the possibility does exist that the location of your position may be changed based on organizational requirements.

Background Investigation:

The successful candidate will need to successfully complete the following clearances:
• Criminal history check
• Reference check

Management Conductor Program:

Becoming a qualified conductor or locomotive engineer is the single best way for a management employee to learn the business at CPKC. You may be required to obtain a certification or to maintain your current certification/qualification as a conductor or locomotive engineer.

CPKC is an employment equity employer committed to the principles of employment equity and inclusion. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply including women, Black, Indigenous, People of Colour (BIPOC), members of the LGBTQ+ community, and people with disabilities. Accommodations for the job application process can be provided, as appropriate, upon request. All applicant information will be managed in accordance with the federal Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA).

CPKC is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, inclusive of protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Data Entry Admin
description:
Acuren Group is currently recruiting a Data Entry Admin. This position will include uploading inspection data info into client systems. If you are seeking a dynamic industrial environment with opportunities for individual growth and learning, this is for you.

Responsibilities
• Uploading inspection data into client systems
• Electronic filing of client admin documents
• Maintain schedule and excel files
• Adhere to a 6/1 shift schedule 12 hours/day

Requirements
• Minimum 2 years of data entry and site admin experience in a related industry
• Intermediate MS Office skills– Primarily working within Outlook and Excel
• Fieldglass experience would be an asset
• Business or Office Administration Certificate/Diploma/Degree an asset
• Experience with data entry with a strong attention to detail
• Strong time management skills with ability to prioritize competing tasks
• Able to work independently, with minimal supervision

Benefits

The strength of Acuren lies in its’ outstanding people As a rapidly growing, intensely innovative, international privately held company, the opportunities to pursue challenging and diverse career development paths are vast. Complemented by an attractive and comprehensive total compensation package and a commitment to the principles of a respectful workplace, Acuren offers tremendous opportunities to those who wish to succeed.

Company Overview

Acuren Bio

Acuren is a trusted, single source provider of technology-enabled asset protection solutions used to evaluate the structural integrity of critical energy, industrial and public infrastructures. Committed to delivering a Higher Level of Reliability , Acuren provides an unrivaled spectrum of capabilities including inspection, traditional and advanced NDE/NDT, failure analysis, rope access, materials engineering, field engineering, reliability engineering, drones, robotics, V-Deck and condition-based monitoring services.

Our work is critical to the integrity and safety of industrial firms, including petroleum refinery, pipeline, power generation, pulp & paper, mining, pharmaceutical, aerospace and automotive industries. Acuren employs over 4,000 dedicated professionals supporting the mechanical integrity and inspection programs of the world’s largest industrial segments.

Acuren is a market leader. Our formula for success is straightforward: be capable locally, with certified and well-equipped personnel supported by trained, experienced leaders. Continuing to build on a strong heritage of safety, quality and professionalism, Acuren strives to maintain incident free work environments, pursues advanced technical developments, and supports reliability programs that are valued by clients and employees

title: Staff Data Engineer
description:
Job Description:

Rakuten International oversees 7 businesses with over 4,000 employees globally. The brand is recognized for its leadership and innovation in e-commerce, digital content, advertising, entertainment and communications, bringing the joy of discovery and access to more than 1 billion members across the world. Our teams deliver on the company’s mission to delight merchants and customers through innovation, optimism, and teamwork.

Rakuten Rewards is a leading e-commerce company that enhances the way people shop by offering Cash Back, deals and rewards from more than 3,500 merchants. Founded in 1999, Rakuten has grown to become the go-to shopping destination for consumers, having paid out nearly $2 billion in Cash Back to its 15 million members. The company also operates ShopStyle, a leading fashion discovery destination, and Cartera Commerce, a top rewards platform for airlines and banks. For more information, visit www.rakuten.com.

Job Summary:

We’re looking for a Staff Data Engineer with strong back-end experience to join our growing Data Engineering team. Our group, based out of San Mateo, CA, is responsible for building software used by millions of users. You will work in a Tribe/Squad and supporting data group structure and will maintain enterprise data products related to member, merchant, and transactions data. Our team serves as a cornerstone for various stakeholders including Finance, Legal, Customer Service, Sales, Site Ops, and Data Governance. As part of our team, you’ll experience the best of both worlds, challenging work at a large profitable multinational company with the rapid growth and agility of a startup.

In this role, you will be responsible for processing, reviewing and organizing data. You will provide accurate, timely, and consistent data to the organization and will create data management plans including data acquisition & cleansing, data validation activities, writing specifications for data verifications, etc. You will gather input from cross-functional teams, creating plans that help produce deliverables on schedule while ensuring consistency of data and processes. Lastly, you will oversee and resolve the operational aspects of data management, identifying inefficiencies and implementing process improvements.

Key Responsibilities:
• Develops and maintains robust data models to support business requirements, analytical needs and machine learning use cases.
• Designs and implements efficient ETL/ELT processes to ingest, transform, and load data.
• Optimizes data pipelines for performance, scalability, and reliability.
• Collaborates with cross-functional teams and multiple disciplines to understand data requirements and provide technical expertise on data-related projects.
• Implements data governance best practices to ensure data quality, integrity, and security.
• Builds and maintains documentation for data processes, data dictionaries, and data lineage.
• Applies highly developed knowledge of complex algorithms, data science methods, and statistical analysis techniques to prepare and present data visualizations to key stakeholders and leaders of relevant business units.
• Remains current with industry trends and best practices in data engineering, cloud technologies, and data analytics.
• Coaches and trains junior colleagues in techniques, processes, and responsibilities.

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
• Proven experience (8+ years) as a Data Engineer or similar role, with a focus on data modeling, SQL, Python, and Snowflake.
• Strong proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and querying.
• Hands-on experience with cloud-based data platforms, particularly Snowflake.
• Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, dimensional modeling, and ETL/ELT processes.
• Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.

Minimum Requirements:
• B.S. or M.S in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
• 8-11 years of experience in data engineering or related roles.
• Proficiency in SQL and Python.
• Experience with cloud-based data warehousing platforms.

Five Principles for Success

Our worldwide practices describe specific behaviors that make Rakuten unique and united across the world. We expect Rakuten employees to model these 5 Shugi Principles of Success.

Always improve, Always Advance - Only be satisfied with complete success - Kaizen

Passionately Professional - Take an uncompromising approach to your work and be determined to be the best

Hypothesize - Practice - Validate – Shikumika - Use the Rakuten Cycle to succeed in unknown territory

Maximize Customer Satisfaction - The greatest satisfaction for our teams is seeing their customers smile

Speed!! Speed!! Speed!! - Always be conscious of time - take charge, set clear goals, and engage your team

Rakuten provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type. Rakuten considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, provincial or local laws

title: Senior Big Data Engineer
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will be a Senior Software Developer in Big Data area who will be responsible for developing application for large-scale data processing and analysis. You will work with all stakeholders to design best in class technology solutions.

We value positive attitude, willingness to learn, open communication, teamwork, and commitment to clean, secure and well-tested code.

What will you do?
• Design, develop, and implement software solutions that meet the organization's strategic goals.
• Provide technical influence by sharing deep knowledge and experience.
• Help increase adoption of emerging technology within area of expertise.
• Liaison with business partners to delivery solution based on clients’ needs.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have
• 6+ years of experience combined in programming, small to large-scale applications, frontend and backend engineering, test driven development, microservices and architecture design principles.
• Demonstrated strong team leadership and ability in written and oral communication skills, along with strong presentation skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the stakeholders and project.
• Expert in multiple programming languages / frameworks such as Hadoop, Apache Spark, Python, Scala, Hive
• Version Control (Git)
• DevOps tools like Jenkins, UCD, Checkmark, Helios
• Experience with database engines such as SQL Server, programming experience in writing queries, performance tuning
• Ability to translate business requirements into technology implementation.

Nice to Have
• Bachelor’s degree in software engineering or relevant
• Working experience with REST API, Json, Postman, or Curl

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
• A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
• Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
• Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
• Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
• A world-class training program in financial services
• Flexible work/life balance options
• Opportunities to do challenging work, to take on progressively greater accountabilities, to building close relationships with clients
• Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies.

title: Information Architect Data Scientist – Level 3
description:
Ready to showcase your virtual data centers' cloud applications experience for data science solutions.?
Looking to take on your next long-term contract (3-year) opportunity?

If so, our Ottawa-based federal client has a contract opportunity to consider. The nature of the work is to act as the Data Scientist with a focus on algorithms on structured and unstructured data, sourced internally or externally, to meet GAC’s predictive and prescriptive analytics needs. The Data Scientist will rely on hands-on analytics experience in artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), Natural Language Processing (NLP)/Natural Language Generation (NLG), optimization, and advanced statistical modeling techniques to meet this need.

Advantages
- This is a long-term contract 3-year contract opportunity
- Hybrid is preferred but open to remote work

Responsibilities
▪ Analyze data sets and identify patterns, trends, and insights.
▪ Design and develop models for specific business objectives.
▪ Optimize models for better performance and efficiency.
▪ Evaluate and select appropriate algorithms and techniques.
▪ Implement data preprocessing, feature engineering, and data augmentation techniques.
▪ Build and deploy pipelines and workflows.
▪ Experiment with different models and parameters to achieve optimal outcomes.
▪ Visualize and communicate insights and findings to non-technical stakeholders.
▪ Interpret model outputs and provide actionable recommendations based on results.
▪ Integrate models into existing software systems or platforms.
▪ Fine-tune models for better accuracy, precision, recall, or other metrics.
▪ Conduct testing and experiments to validate model performance.
▪ Apply statistical analysis and hypothesis testing for model validation and insights.
▪ Assist in setting up and managing cloud-based or on-premises data science infrastructure.

▪ Reports summarizing data analysis, patterns, trends, and key insights.
▪ Trained and optimized models tailored to specific objectives.
▪ Detailed documentation of model architecture, algorithms, and parameters.
▪ Engineered features and transformed data suitable for machine learning.
▪ Automated data preprocessing pipelines for seamless model training.
▪ Visualizations of model results, trends, and insights for non-technical stakeholders.
▪ Code for deploying models into production environments.
▪ Evaluation reports, metrics, and comparisons for model performance.
▪ Actionable recommendations based on data analysis and model outcomes.
▪ Test results, experiment design, and statistical analyses.
▪ Training materials and workshops for team members or clients on data science concepts and
techniques.
▪ Strategies for optimizing models for performance, efficiency, or specific metrics.
▪ Techniques and scripts for data cleaning and validation processes.
▪ Comprehensive documentation of experiments, methodologies, and results.
▪ Version-controlled code repositories for models, experiments, and analyses.
▪ Integration strategies for deploying models in cloud-based environments.

Qualifications
- 7 +proficiently analyze data sets using robust industry-endorsed best practices, tools and methods to identify patterns, trends, and insights, demonstrating a strong ability to derive meaningful information from complex
and large data (i.e., big data).
- 7 + selecting appropriate algorithms and techniques based on problem requirements, and effectively implementing data preprocessing and feature engineering.

Summary
The nature of the work is to act as the Data Scientist with a focus on algorithms on structured and unstructured data, sourced internally or externally, to meet GAC’s predictive and prescriptive analytics needs. The Data Scientist will rely on hands-on analytics experience in artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), Natural Language Processing (NLP)/Natural Language Generation (NLG), optimization, and advanced statistical modeling techniques to meet this need.

title: Sr Data Architect, Data Warehousing
description:
At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 25,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can beand grow your career.

In this role you’ll be reporting directly to the Director, Global Data Integration, Enterprise Architecture, working closely with the extended data services team, other architects, technical developers and platform administrators, as well as domain subject matter experts across multiple business areas, and external experts. You will be responsible for delivering global direction for technical data warehouse architecture and project solution architecture for innovative data-centric solutions, working both independently and in collaboration with other architects from the data services team and beyond.

What You Will Do
• Design and develop the target data architecture (e.g. blueprints, standards, solution architectures) that enables the Nutrien business architecture and drives data warehousing, business intelligence, reporting, and advanced analytics as well as data integration
• Strive to implement the target data architecture by identifying candidate architecture roadmap components based upon gaps between the baseline and target data architectures
• Define overarching standards and patterns across the data warehouse solution lifecycle from development to sustainment
• Work with the larger architecture community, various business units, and the development teams to manage the data assets of the organization
• Mentor others on the team and in similar roles throughout the department

What You Will Bring
• Post-secondary degree education at university level at a minimum.
• 8 + years of combined experience delivering solutions and hands-on data roles in a large-scale, heterogeneous IT environment.
• Technical experience in multiple technology domains and understanding of how that technology is used across multiple business functions, in multiple industries, to deliver business value.
• Prior work experience working with technologies like SAP HANA (for data warehousing), other databases and DWs, BI/reporting technologies, SAP, and/or other ERPs
• Deep understanding of Data Warehousing concepts and previous experience in DW & BI environments.
• Exposure to traditional data architecture frameworks (e.g. DMBOK) or certification (e.g. CDMP/CBIP) as well as broader Enterprise Architecture concepts and frameworks (e.g. TOGAF) desirable.
• Technical: You love technology and seeing it applied to solve real problems. In particular, you have a passion for technologies that improve access and visibility to data and you’re not afraid to write some SQL code or build some ELT/ETL data pipelines when the need arises. In addition you love staying on top of current developments and can take the hype and excitement from the general world and turn it into a compelling roadmap for Nutrien.
• Problem Solving: You don’t stop until the problem gets solved, no matter how complex, and you find more than one way to solve it. You don’t just test that it doesn’t break, you test until it doesn’t break. You love working with other people, presenting your viewpoint but ultimately working to-wards the best, most sustainable architectures and solutions. You enjoy working on roadmaps and architectures that will be here for the long-term and have a transformational impact on the organization.
• Communication: You are a strong communicator, whether it is written, verbal, or presenting ideas. You also enjoy collaborating with people on different teams and continue to maintain high levels of visibility, efficiency, and collaboration. You possess tactful negotiation and persuasion skills to help build enterprise alignment on optimal data management and analytics practices at Nutrien. You are not afraid to provide guidance to mentees, peers, and leaders when appropriate.
• Business Analysis: You know the questions to ask to get to the heart of the matter. You leverage your relationships across IT and business to target compelling data warehouse architecture.

Are you a good match? Apply today!

The estimated salary that Indeed, Glassdoor and LinkedIn suggested does not represent Nutrien's compensation structure.

Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

To stay connected to us and for the latest job postings and news, follow us on: LinkedIn , Facebook and Twitter

title: Data Administrator - 5 Month Contract
description:
Requirements

Description & Requirements

WHO WE ARE

Lululemon is a yoga inspired technical apparel company up to big things. The practice and philosophy of yoga informs our overall purpose to elevate the world through the power of practice. We are proud to be a growing global company with locations all around the world, from Vancouver to Shanghai and places in between. We owe our success to our innovative product, our emphasis on our stores, our commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we get to make in every community we are in.

About This Team

Our Global Distribution teams are part of our greater lululemon Supply Chain organization. This team supports lululemon’s overall purpose by ensuring we are fulfilling our products to our guests through our various channels including our retail stores and ecommerce.

A DAY IN THE LIFE
• Supports the Supervisor with daily administrative tasks for their assigned department
• Supports Supervisor with daily email communication to business partners
• Supports with ensuring system accuracy within their department (IBM, WMS, LMS)
• Provides regular and adhoc reporting to Floor Leads and Supervisor for their department
• Will be assigned to a main department, however, may be required to support all areas of the distribution center including but not limited to value added services, receiving, returns, damages, picking, packing, transfers, shipping, and overall movement of inventory as business needs dictate with general department tasks.
• Engage in training, team building, meetings, and personal development.
• Responsible for maintaining a safe work environment through our safety program and lean mentality. Responsible for performing job duties in accordance with DC Guidelines and company policies
• Keeping the warehouse clean and always organized
• Performs other duties and projects as assigned by leadership

Qualifications
• Knowledge of Manhattan and WMS
• Ability to communicate professionally with business stakeholders both written and verbally
• Ability to effectively listen and provide direction to hourly workforce
• Basic computer skills including Microsoft Excel
• Demonstrated ability to analyze reporting
• Capable of adapting to third party technologies (RF scanners, voice picking and new systems)
• Excellent counting skills and detail focused
• Ability to meet attendance requirements
• Ability to lift up to 50lbs frequently
• Ability to maintain a safe work environment
• Flexible and adaptable with schedule which could include nights, working required holidays, weekends with occasional after-hours requirements and overtime

MUST HAVES
• Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life
• Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results.
• Communicates with honesty and kindness and creates the space for others to do the same.
• Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.
• Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
• Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously.

Compensation And Benefits Package

lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional team performance. The base pay range for this position is from $21.60-$25.41/hour, subject to minimum wage in the location. The base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. This position has a target bonus of an additional 5%, subject to certain requirements and the Company’s discretion, bringing the total hourly target compensation range between $22.68-$26.68

At Lululemon, Investing In Our People Is a Top Priority. We Believe That When Life Works, Work Works. We Strive To Be The Place Where Inclusive Leaders Come To Develop And Enable All To Be Well. Recognizing Our Teams For Their Performance And Dedication, Other Components Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include Support Of Career Development, Wellbeing, And Personal Growth
• Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans
• Paid time off
• Savings and retirement plan matching
• Generous employee discount
• Fitness & yoga classes
• Parenthood top-up
• Extensive catalog of development course offerings
• People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few)

Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

QUIÉNES SOMOS

Lululemon es una compañía de indumentaria técnica inspirada en el yoga que apunta a grandes objetivos. La práctica y la filosofía del yoga dan forma a nuestro propósito general de elevar el mundo a través del poder de la práctica. Nos enorgullece ser una compañía global en crecimiento con ubicaciones en todo el mundo al otro, desde Vancouver hasta Shanghái. Debemos nuestro éxito a los productos innovadores que ofrecemos, al énfasis que ponemos en nuestras tiendas, al compromiso que tenemos con nuestra gente y a las increíbles conexiones que logramos establecer en cada comunidad en la que nos encontramos.

ACERCA DE ESTE EQUIPO

Nuestros equipos de Distribución global forman parte de la gran organización de la cadena de suministro de lululemon. Este equipo apoya el propósito general de lululemon al garantizar que entreguemos nuestros productos a los clientes a través de nuestros diversos canales, incluidas nuestras tiendas minoristas y el ecommerce.

UN DÍA EN LA VIDA
• Apoya al supervisor con las tareas administrativas diarias para su departamento asignado.
• Apoya al supervisor con la comunicación diaria por correo electrónico con los socios comerciales.
• Ayuda a garantizar la precisión del sistema dentro de su departamento (IBM, WMS, LMS).
• Proporciona informes regulares y ad hoc a los jefes de planta y al supervisor de su departamento.
• Se le asignará a un departamento principal; sin embargo, es posible que se le requiera para brindar apoyo a todas las áreas del centro de distribución (distribution center, DC), incluidos, entre otros, servicios de valor agregado, recepción, devoluciones, daños, recolección, empaque, transferencias, envíos y movimiento general de inventario, según lo requieran las necesidades comerciales con las tareas generales del departamento.
• Participación en capacitación, trabajo en equipo, reuniones y desarrollo personal.
• Es responsable de mantener un ambiente de trabajo seguro a través de nuestro programa de seguridad y mentalidad eficiente. Es responsable de realizar las tareas laborales de acuerdo con las pautas para el DC y las políticas de la compañía.
• Mantiene la bodega limpia y siempre organizada.
• Realiza otras tareas y proyectos asignados por el liderazgo.

APTITUDES
• Conocimiento de Manhattan y WMS.
• Capacidad para comunicarse profesionalmente con las partes interesadas del negocio, tanto por escrito como en forma verbal.
• Capacidad para escuchar de manera efectiva y brindar orientación al personal que trabaja por hora.
• Habilidades informáticas básicas, incluido Microsoft Excel.
• Capacidad demostrada para analizar informes.
• Capacidad de adaptación a tecnologías de terceros (escáneres de RF, sistemas de picking por voz y nuevos sistemas).
• Excelentes habilidades de conteo y atención a los detalles.
• Capacidad de cumplir con los requisitos de asistencia.
• Capacidad de levantar hasta 22.68 kilos (50 libras) con frecuencia.
• Capacidad de mantener un ambiente de trabajo seguro.
• Flexible y adaptable, con un horario que podría incluir noches, requisito de trabajo en días festivos, fines de semana con requisitos ocasionales de horas fuera de turno y horas extra.

REQUISITOS OBLIGATORIOS
• Reconocer la posibilidad de elegir en cada momento y asumir la responsabilidad personal por su vida.
• Poseer un espíritu emprendedor e innovar continuamente para lograr grandes resultados.
• Comunicarse con honestidad y amabilidad, y crear el espacio para que otros hagan lo mismo.
• Liderar con valentía, sabiendo que la posibilidad de la grandeza es más grande que el miedo al fracaso.
• Fomentar la conexión, poniendo a las personas primero y construyendo relaciones de confianza.
• Integrar la diversión y la alegría como una forma de ser y trabajar, es decir, no tomarse a sí mismo con demasiada seriedad.

हम कौन हैं

lululemon बड़ी चीजों तक एक योग प्रेरित तकनीकी परिधान कंपनी है। योग का अभ्यास और दर्शन अभ्यास की शक्ति के माध्यम से दुनिया को ऊपर उठाने के हमारे समग्र उद्देश्य को बताता है। हमें वैंकूवर से शंघाई तक और बीच के स्थानों सहित दुनिया भर के स्थानों वाली एक बढ़ती हुई वैश्विक कंपनी होने पर गर्व है। हम अपनी सफलता का श्रेय अपने नवोन्मेषी उत्पाद, अपने स्टोर्स पर हमारे जोर, अपने लोगों के प्रति हमारी प्रतिबद्धता और हर उस समुदाय में बनाने के लिए अविश्वसनीय कनेक्शनों को देते हैं, जिसमें हम हैं।

टीम के बारे में

हमारी वैश्विक वितरण टीमें हमारे बड़े lululemon आपूर्ति संगठन का हिस्सा हैं। यह टीम यह सुनिश्चित करके lululemon के समग्र उद्देश्य का समर्थन करती है कि हम अपने खुदरा स्टोर और ईकॉमर्स सहित अपने विभिन्न चैनलों के माध्यम से अपने उत्पादों को अपने अतिथियों को संतुष्ट कर रहे हैं।

ज़िंदगी का एक दिन
• अपने सौंपे गए विभाग के लिए दैनिक प्रशासनिक कार्यों में पर्यवेक्षक की सहायता करता है
• व्यावसायिक भागदारों से मेल संचार में पर्यवेक्षक की सहायता करता है
• अपने विभाग (IBM, WMS, LMS) के भीतर सिस्टम सटीकता सुनिश्चित करने में सहायता करता है
• फ्लोर लीड और पर्यवेक्षक को उनके विभाग के लिए नियमित और तदर्थ रिपोर्टिंग प्रदान करता है
• किसी मुख्य विभाग को सौंपा जाएगा, हालांकि, वितरण केंद्र के सभी क्षेत्रों में सहायता करने की आवश्यकता हो सकती है, जिसमें मूल्य वर्धित सेवाएं, प्राप्त करना, रिटर्न, हर्जाना, चुनना, पैकिंग, स्थानांतरण, शिपिंग और इन्वेंट्री की समग्र आवाजाही शामिल है, लेकिन इन्हीं तक सीमित नहीं है, क्योंकि व्यवसाय को सामान्य विभाग के कार्यों में निर्देशित करने की आवश्यकता होती है।
• प्रशिक्षण, टीम निर्माण, बैठकों और व्यक्तित्व विकास में संलग्न होता है
• हमारे सुरक्षा कार्यक्रम और आडंबरहीन मानसिकता के माध्यम से एक सुरक्षित कार्य वातावरण बनाए रखने के लिए जिम्मेदार। डीसी दिशानिर्देशों और कंपनी की नीतियों के अनुसार नौकरी कर्तव्यों का पालन करने के लिए जिम्मेदार
• वेयरहाउस को हमेशा साफ और संगठित रखना
• नेतृत्व द्वारा सौंपे गए अन्य कर्तव्य और परियोजनाएं करता है

योग्यताएं
• Manhattan और WMS की जानकारी
• व्यावसायिक हितधारकों से लिखित और मौखिक दोनों पेशेवर रूप से संचारित करने की क्षमता
• प्रभावी रूप से सुनने और प्रति घंटे कार्यबल को दिशानिर्देश प्रदान करने की क्षमता
• Microsoft Excel सहित बुनियादी कंप्यूटर कौशल
• रिपोर्टिंग का विश्लेषण करने की क्षमता प्रदर्शित की
• तृतीय पक्ष प्रौद्योगिकियों (आरएफ स्केनर्स, वॉइस पिकिंग और नए सिस्टम) से अनुकूलन करने में सक्षम
• उत्कृष्ट गणना कौशल और विवरण केंद्रित
• उपस्थिति आवश्यकताओं को पूरा करने की क्षमता
• अक्सर 50 पाउंड तक उठाने की क्षमता
• एक सुरक्षित कार्य वातावरण बनाए रखने की क्षमता
• शेड्यूल के साथ लचीला और अनुकूलनीय जिसमें रातें, काम करने के लिए आवश्यक छुट्टियां, कभी-कभी बाद के घंटों की आवश्यकताओं के साथ सप्ताहांत और ओवरटाइम शामिल हो सकते हैं

अनिवार्य
• हर पल पसंद की उपस्थिति को स्वीकार करता है और अपने जीवन के लिए व्यक्तिगत जिम्मेदारी लेता है
• एक उद्यमशीलता की भावना रखता है और अच्छे परिणाम प्राप्त करने के लिए लगातार नवाचार करता है।
• ईमानदारी और दयालुता के साथ संवाद करता है और दूसरों के लिए भी ऐसा करने के लिए जगह बनाता है।
• साहस के साथ आगे बढ़ता है, महानता की संभावना को जानना असफलता के डर से बड़ा होता है।
• लोगों को प्राथमिकता देकर और भरोसेमंद रिश्ते बनाकर कनेक्शन को बढ़ावा देता है।
• मस्ती और आनंद को होने और काम करने के तरीके के रूप में एकीकृत करता है, उर्फ खुद को बहुत गंभीरता से नहीं लेता है।

ਅਸੀਂ ਕੌਣ ਹਾਂ

lululemon ਕੱਪੜਿਆਂ ਦੀ ਯੋਗ ਪ੍ਰੇਰਿਤ ਤਕਨੀਕੀ ਕੰਪਨੀ ਹੈ ਜੋ ਉੱਚੀਆਂ ਛਲਾਂਗਾਂ ਮਾਰ ਰਹੀ ਹੈ। ਯੋਗ ਦਾ ਅਭਿਆਸ ਅਤੇ ਫ਼ਲਸਫ਼ਾ ਅਭਿਆਸ ਦੀ ਤਾਕਤ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਦੁਨੀਆਂ ਦਾ ਮਿਆਰ ਉੱਚਾ ਚੁੱਕਣ ਦੇ ਸਾਡੇ ਸਮੁੱਚੇ ਉਦੇਸ਼ ਦੀ ਸੂਚਨਾ ਦਿੰਦਾ ਹੈ। ਸਾਨੂੰ ਇੱਕ ਅਜਿਹੀ ਵਿਕਸਿਤ ਹੋ ਰਹੀ ਵਿਸ਼ਵਵਿਆਪੀ ਕੰਪਨੀ ਬਣ ਕੇ ਮਾਣ ਮਹਿਸੂਸ ਹੁੰਦਾ ਹੈ ਜਿਸ ਦੀਆਂ ਸ਼ਾਖਾਵਾਂ ਵੈਨਕੂਵਰ ਤੋਂ ਸ਼ੰਘਾਈ ਅਤੇ ਇਸ ਵਿਚਾਲੇ ਬਹੁਤ ਸਾਰੀਆਂ ਥਾਂਵਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਸਥਿਤ ਹਨ। ਅਸੀਂ ਆਪਣੀ ਸਫਲਤਾ ਨੂੰ, ਸਾਡੇ ਨਵੀਨ ਉਤਪਾਦ, ਸਾਡੇ ਸਟੋਰਸ ਉੱਤੇ ਸਾਡੇ ਜ਼ੋਰ, ਸਾਡੇ ਕਰਮਚਾਰੀਆਂ ਪ੍ਰਤੀ ਸਾਡੇ ਇਕਰਾਰ, ਅਤੇ ਆਪਣੀ ਹਰੇਕ ਬਰਾਦਰੀ ਵਿੱਚ ਜਿਹੜੇ ਸ਼ਾਨਦਾਰ ਸਬੰਧ ਅਸੀਂ ਬਣਾਉਂਦੇ ਹਾਂ, ਇਹਨਾਂ ਦੇ ਲੇਖੇ ਜੋੜਦੇ ਹਾਂ।

ਇਸ ਟੀਮ ਬਾਰੇ

ਸਾਡੀਆਂ ਵਿਸ਼ਵਵਿਆਪੀ ਵਿਤਰਨ ਟੀਮਾਂ ਸਾਡੇ ਵੱਡੇ lululemon ਸਪਲਾਈ ਚੇਨ ਸੰਗਠਨ ਦਾ ਹਿੱਸਾ ਹਨ। ਇਹ ਟੀਮ lululemon ਦੇ ਸਮੁੱਚੇ ਉਦੇਸ਼ ਦਾ ਸਮਰਥਨ ਇਹ ਯਕੀਨੀ ਬਣਾ ਕੇ ਕਰਦੀ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਅਸੀਂ ਆਪਣੇ ਰੀਟੇਲ ਸਟੋਰਸ ਅਤੇ ਈਕਾਮਰਸ ਸਮੇਤ ਸਾਡੇ ਭਿੰਨ-ਭਿੰਨ ਚੈਨਲਾਂ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਆਪਣੇ ਮਹਿਮਾਨਾਂ ਲਈ ਆਪਣੇ ਉਤਪਾਦਾਂ ਦੀ ਪੂਰਤੀ ਕਰ ਰਹੇ ਹਾਂ।

ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ਦਾ ਇੱਕ ਦਿਨ
• ਸੁਪਰਵਾਈਜ਼ਰ ਨੂੰ ਉਹਨਾਂ ਲਈ ਸਪੁਰਦ ਕੀਤੇ ਵਿਭਾਗ ਲਈ ਰੋਜ਼ਾਨਾ ਦੇ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਾਸਕੀ ਕੰਮਾਂ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਸਹਿਯੋਗ ਦਿੰਦਾ ਹੈ
• ਵਪਾਰਕ ਸਾਥੀਆਂ ਨੂੰ ਰੋਜ਼ਾਨਾ ਈਮੇਲ ਸੰਚਾਰ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਸੁਪਰਵਾਈਜ਼ਰ ਨੂੰ ਸਹਿਯੋਗ ਦਿੰਦਾ ਹੈ
• ਉਹਨਾਂ ਦੇ ਵਿਭਾਗ ਦੇ ਅੰਦਰ (IBM, WMS, LMS) ਸਿਸਟਮ ਦੀ ਸਟੀਕਤਾ ਨੂੰ ਯਕੀਨੀ ਬਣਾ ਕੇ ਸਮਰਥਨ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ
• ਫਲੋਰ ਲੀਡ ਅਤੇ ਸੁਪਰਵਾਈਜ਼ਰ ਨੂੰ ਉਹਨਾਂ ਦੇ ਵਿਭਾਗ ਲਈ ਨਿਯਮਿਤ ਅਤੇ ਉਚੇਚੀ ਸੂਚਨਾ ਪ੍ਰਦਾਨ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ
• ਮੁੱਖ ਵਿਭਾਗ ਲਈ ਸਪੁਰਦ ਕੀਤਾ ਜਾਵੇਗਾ, ਪਰ, ਵਿਤਰਨ ਕੇਂਦਰ ਦੇ ਸਾਰੇ ਖੇਤਰਾਂ ਦਾ ਸਮਰਥਨ ਕਰਨ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਹੋ ਸਕਦੀ ਹੈ ਜਿਸ ਵਿੱਚ ਮਹੱਤਵ ਵਧਾਈਆਂ ਗਈਆਂ ਸੇਵਾਵਾਂ, ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤੀ, ਵਾਪਸੀ, ਨੁਕਸਾਨ, ਪਿੱਕ ਕਰਨਾ, ਪੈਕ ਕਰਨਾ, ਟ੍ਰਾਂਸਫਰ, ਸ਼ਿੱਪਿੰਗ, ਅਤੇ ਵਸਤੂ-ਸੂਚੀ ਨੂੰ ਸਮੁੱਚੇ ਤੌਰ ‘ਤੇ ਲਿਜਾਉਣਾ ਸ਼ਾਮਲ ਹੈ ਪਰ ਇਹਨਾਂ ਤਕ ਸੀਮਿਤ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ, ਜਿਵੇਂ ਕਾਰੋਬਾਰੀ ਜ਼ਰੂਰਤਾਂ ਸਾਧਾਰਨ ਵਿਭਾਗੀ ਕਾਰਜਾਂ ਦੇ ਅਨੁਸਾਰ ਦੱਸਦੀਆਂ ਹਨ।
• ਸਿਖਲਾਈ, ਟੀਮ ਦੇ ਨਿਰਮਾਣ, ਮੁਲਾਕਾਤਾਂ, ਅਤੇ ਨਿੱਜੀ ਵਿਕਾਸ ਵਿੱਚ ਸ਼ਾਮਲ ਹੋਣਾ।
• ਸਾਡੇ ਸੁਰੱਖਿਆ ਪ੍ਰੋਗਰਾਮ ਅਤੇ ਲੀਨ ਮਾਨਸਿਕਤਾ ਦੇ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਕੰਮ ਦਾ ਸੁਰੱਖਿਅਤ ਵਾਤਾਵਰਣ ਬਰਕਰਾਰ ਰੱਖਣ ਲਈ ਜ਼ਿੰਮੇਵਾਰ। ਵਿਤਰਨ ਕੇਂਦਰ (Distribution Center, DC) ਦਿਸ਼ਾ-ਨਿਰਦੇਸ਼ਾਂ ਅਤੇ ਕੰਪਨੀ ਦੀਆਂ ਨੀਤੀਆਂ ਦੇ ਅਨੁਸਾਰ ਕੰਮ ਦੇ ਫਰਜ਼ ਪੂਰੇ ਕਰਨ ਲਈ ਜ਼ਿੰਮੇਵਾਰ
• ਗੋਦਾਮ ਨੂੰ ਸਾਫ਼ ਅਤੇ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਵਿਵਸਥਿਤ ਰੱਖਣਾ
• ਲੀਡਰਸ਼ਿਪ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਸਪੁਰਦ ਕੀਤੇ ਗਏ ਅਨੁਸਾਰ ਦੂਜੇ ਫਰਜ਼ ਅਤੇ ਪ੍ਰੋਜੈਕਟ ਪੂਰੇ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ

ਯੋਗਤਾਵਾਂ
• Manhattan ਅਤੇ WMS ਦੀ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ
• ਲਿਖਤ ਅਤੇ ਮੂੰਹ-ਜ਼ਬਾਨੀ ਦੋਹਾਂ ਤਰੀਕਿਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਵਪਾਰਕ ਹਿੱਤ-ਧਾਰਕਾਂ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਪੇਸ਼ੇਵਰ ਤੌਰ ‘ਤੇ ਸੰਚਾਰ ਕਰਨ ਦੀ ਯੋਗਤਾ
• ਅਸਰਦਾਰ ਢੰਗ ਨਾਲ ਸੁਣਨ ਅਤੇ ਘੰਟਾਵਾਰ ਮਜ਼ਦੂਰਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਦਿਸ਼ਾ ਪ੍ਰਦਾਨ ਕਰਨ ਦੀ ਯੋਗਤਾ
• Microsoft Excel ਸਮੇਤ ਕੰਪਿਊਟਰ ਦੇ ਬੇਸਿਕ ਗੁਣ
• ਰਿਪੋਰਟਿੰਗ ਦਾ ਵਿਸ਼ਲੇਸ਼ਣ ਕਰਨ ਦੀ ਯੋਗਤਾ ਦਿਖਾਈ
• ਤੀਜੀ ਧਿਰ ਦੀਆਂ ਤਕਨੀਕਾਂ ਦੇ ਅਨੁਕੂਲ ਹੋਣ ਦੇ ਸਮਰੱਥ (ਰੇਡੀਓ ਫ੍ਰੀਕਵੈਂਸੀ/Radio Frequency, RF), ਆਵਾਜ਼ ਦੀ ਚੋਣ ਕਰਨਾ ਅਤੇ ਨਵੀਆਂ ਪ੍ਰਣਾਲੀਆਂ)
• ਗਿਣਤੀ ਦੀਆਂ ਸ਼ਾਨਦਾਰ ਕੁਸ਼ਲਤਾਵਾਂ ਅਤੇ ਵੇਰਵੇ 'ਤੇ ਕੇਂਦ੍ਰਿਤ
• ਹਾਜ਼ਰੀ ਸਬੰਧੀ ਜ਼ਰੂਰਤਾਂ ਪੂਰੀਆਂ ਕਰਨ ਦੀ ਯੋਗਤਾ
• ਅਕਸਰ 50lbs ਨੂੰ ਚੁੱਕਣ ਦੀ ਯੋਗਤਾ
• ਕੰਮ ਦਾ ਸੁਰੱਖਿਅਤ ਵਾਤਾਵਰਣ ਬਰਕਰਾਰ ਰੱਖਣ ਦੀ ਯੋਗਤਾ
• ਅਜਿਹੀ ਅਨੁਸੂਚੀ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਲਚਕਸ਼ੀਲ ਅਤੇ ਅਨੁਕੂਲਿਤ ਜਿਸ ਵਿੱਚ ਰਾਤ, ਛੁੱਟੀਆਂ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਲੋੜੀਂਦਾ ਕੰਮ, ਕਦੇ-ਕਦਾਈਂ ਕੰਮ-ਮਗਰਲੇ ਸਮੇਂ ਸਬੰਧੀ ਜ਼ਰੂਰਤਾਂ ਅਤੇ ਓਵਰਟਾਈਮ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਵੀਕੈਂਡ ਸ਼ਾਮਲ ਹੋ ਸਕਦੇ ਹਨ

ਜ਼ਰੂਰ ਹੋਣਾ ਚਾਹੀਦਾ ਹੈ
• ਹਰ ਪਲ ਵਿੱਚ ਚੋਣ ਦੀ ਮੌਜੂਦਗੀ ਨੂੰ ਸਵੀਕਾਰ ਕਰਦੇ ਹਨ ਅਤੇ ਆਪਣੇ ਜੀਵਨ ਲਈ ਨਿੱਜੀ ਜ਼ਿੰਮੇਵਾਰੀ ਲੈਂਦੇ ਹਨ
• ਉੱਦਮੀ ਭਾਵਨਾ ਰੱਖਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਸ਼ਾਨਦਾਰ ਨਤੀਜੇ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ ਕਰਨ ਲਈ ਲਗਾਤਾਰ ਨਵੀਨਤਾ ਲਿਆਉਂਦਾ ਹੈ।
• ਈਮਾਨਦਾਰੀ ਅਤੇ ਨੇਕਨੀਤੀ ਨਾਲ ਗੱਲਬਾਤ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਦੂਜਿਆਂ ਵਲੋਂ ਵੀ ਇਹੋ ਕੀਤੇ ਜਾਣ ਦਾ ਮੌਕਾ ਦਿੰਦਾ ਹੈ।
• ਹਿੰਮਤ ਨਾਲ ਅਗੁਆਈ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ, ਇਹ ਜਾਣਦੇ ਹੋਏ ਕਿ ਵਡਿਆਈ ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਅਸਫਲਤਾ ਦੇ ਡਰ ਤੋਂ ਵੱਡੀ ਹੁੰਦੀ ਹੈ।
• ਲੋਕਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਪਹਿਲ ਦੇ ਕੇ ਅਤੇ ਵਿਸ਼ਵਾਸੀ ਰਿਸ਼ਤੇ ਬਣਾ ਕੇ ਸੰਬੰਧਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਵਧਾਵਾ ਦਿੰਦਾ ਹੈ।
• ਮੌਜੂਦਗੀ ਅਤੇ ਕੰਮ ਕਰਨ ਦੇ ਤਰੀਕੇ ਵਜੋਂ ਮੋਜ ਅਤੇ ਮਸਤੀ ਨੂੰ ਸ਼ਾਮਲ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ, ਯਾਂਨੀ ਆਪਣੇ-ਆਪ ਨੂੰ ਬਹੁਤ ਗੰਭੀਰਤਾ ਨਾਲ ਨਹੀਂ ਲੈਂਦੇ।

title: Associate Director, IT Risk Lead Data Scientist
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Associate Directory, IT Risk Lead data scientist. Analyze, design and implement data science/machine learning solutions to discover and visualize IT Risk patterns and trends for Capital Market IT group.

What will you do?
• Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes.
• Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, and proposing solutions and strategies to business challenges
• Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns.
• Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms. and present information using data visualization techniques.
• Work with internal development team and the clients’ technologies team to design effective programming and software changes.
• Lead the development and integration of ML solution and technologies to automate reporting solutions

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have
• Extensive experience in AI/ML development and deployment demonstrating a deep understanding of machine learning algorithms, models, and framework.
• Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python or Java, and experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries.
• RDBMS, SQL Database design and implementation
• Ability to understand business requirements and align ML solutions with business goals, identify opportunities for ML applications, and communicate the value and potential impact to the organization.

Nice to Have
• IT Risk Management experience
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
• Demonstrated success in applying agile best-practices to frame problems and prioritize key outcomes; hypothesize, iterate, and continuously improve on solutions; and continuously deliver incremental value to end-users and key stakeholders.
• Previous experience in Capital Market or Financial industry.
• Tableau

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
• A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
• Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
• Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
• Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
• Opportunities to do challenging work, progressively greater accountabilities and to building close relationships with clients
• Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies.

#:LI-Hybrid

#LI-Post

#TECHPJ

#EVP3P4

Job Skills
Business Continuity Disaster Recovery, Cyber Security Management, Data Visualization, Information Security Management, IT Network Security, Machine Learning, Machine Learning Algorithms, Microsoft SQL Database, Problem Management, Python (Programming Language), Python for Data Analysis, Visualization Techniques

BEDFORD

title: Data Entry Clerk
description:
Randstad Canada is currently hiring a Data Entry Clerk for one of our renowned clients in the document storage field.

It is located in Burnaby.

We are hiring for the following shift:

7:00 AM - 3:30 PM, Mondays - Fridays

This position pays $19.41 an hour

A reliability clearance will be required.

Advantages
- working in a neat and organized facility
- ability to develop job skills and become familiar with warehouse storage principles
- weekly pay cycles
-opt in medical and dental benefits from day one

Responsibilities
The Data Entry Specialist pulls individual medical files from the storage box, identifies required data fields from each file, and enters that information into the database for the client. One box at a time is carried to the workstation, where individual files are pulled and data is entered. When all files have been reviewed, they are returned to the box, which is in turn carried back to the pallet. Maximum storage height on each pallet is 5 boxes. Except for the periods when boxes are physically being moved (5% of time), work is performed from a seated position (95% of time).

Qualifications
- able to work in a sitting position for the majority of the role
- must be able to complete a criminal background check
- This position requires a reliability clearance. This means that you will need to get fingerprinting completed for the role. You will have to pay for the fingerprints, however, you will be reimbursed for the fingerprints after your first month of working. Although you may be offered the position right away, you would not be able to start in the role until the reliability clearance has cleared which could take anywhere from a few days to a few weeks.

Summary
Interested? Apply directly to this posting or email shoipatri.basu@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process

title: Data Entry Clerk
description:
Your new company

Hays Specialist Recruitment has partnered with a parking company located in Montreal, QC. We are looking to hire a Data Entry Clerk to join their team on a contract basis of 6 months, which has the possibility of extension/ permanent.

Your new role
• Data entry and maintenance of the contract database.
• Analysis of contracts to update the contract database.
• Participation in the transfer of contractual agreements to Indigo’s platform.
• Serving as the primary point of contact for coordination and communication between the finance team and other departments within the organization.
• Assisting in the processing of insurance claims and related documentation.
• Ensuring contractor compliance requirements.

What you'll need to succeed
• Data entry experience
• Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Word and Excel.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
• Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
• Bilingualism is required, as the role involves working in partnership with individuals within Canada.
• Legal environment experience is an asset.

What you'll get in return

This position is offering up to $27.00 per hour

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Titre du poste : Ingénieur Données Principal

Lieu : Ville St-Laurent

Description du poste :

Êtes-vous un passionné de l'ingénierie des données avec une envie de créer des solutions de données solides ? Avez-vous de l'expérience avec Snowflake, DBT et Python, et prospérez-vous dans un environnement collaboratif et familial ? Si c'est le cas, nous avons une opportunité passionnante pour vous !

Aperçu du poste :

En tant qu'Ingénieur Data Principal, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel au sein de notre écosystème de données. Vous servirez de chef technique, guidant et encadrant une équipe de professionnels des données. Vos responsabilités incluront la revue de code, le leadership technique et la garantie du développement réussi de pipelines de données.

Responsabilités clés :
• Diriger le développement au sein de nos piles de données actuelles, y compris Snowflake, DBT et l'architecture sans serveur AWS.
• Fournir des conseils techniques et un mentorat aux ingénieurs de données développeurs et analystes.
• Superviser la conception et le développement de pipelines de données, ingérant des données provenant de sources diverses et les transformant en modèles propres et évolutifs pour la BI, l'analyse et l'intégration système.
• Évaluer et mettre en œuvre des outils d'orchestration des données tels qu'Airflow ou Dagster pour gérer et surveiller efficacement les pipelines de données.
• Établir et surveiller les processus de qualité des données pour garantir la fourniture de données précises, fiables et opportunes à nos utilisateurs.
• Mettre en œuvre des processus d'évaluation continue des coûts et des performances de l'infrastructure et des outils au sein de notre plateforme de données.

Qualifications :
• Une maîtrise solide de Python est indispensable.
• De l'expérience avec des piles de données similaires telles que Databricks, Redshift ou BigQuery est un atout.
• De bonnes compétences en communication, car vous collaborerez étroitement avec les parties prenantes.
• 3 ans d'expérience pertinente, avec au moins 1 an en tant qu'ingénieur data principal ou en tant qu'ingénieur data sénior prêt à assumer un rôle de leadership.
• Bilingue en anglais et disposé à apprendre le français.
• À l'aise pour travailler 2 à 3 jours sur site avec un horaire flexible de 40 heures commençant avant 9h30.

Ce que nous offrons :
• Salaire compétitif avec un bonus annuel de 10 %.
• Opportunités de croissance de carrière au sein d'une équipe en expansion rapide avec un potentiel de postes de gestion ou d'architecture d'entreprise.
• Une culture familiale détendue avec une équipe passionnée.
• Avantages incluant le REER après 3 ans, une allocation fitness de 300 $, des vendredis d'été (fin à 13h), une cafétéria sur place avec un chef à 8 $, un barista, petit-déjeuner gratuit, des activités de renforcement d'équipe, et bien plus encore.
• Des remises généreuses sur les produits liés à la marque et les produits à marque privée, ainsi que des plans d'assurance couvrant les soins médicaux, dentaires, les soins virtuels, l'invalidité de longue durée et l'assurance vie.

Pourquoi nous rejoindre :

Découvrez une culture unique qui donne l'impression de faire partie de la famille.

Profitez d'une équipe avec une excellente chimie et un faible taux de rotation.

Faites partie d'une grande organisation qui fonctionne comme une petite entreprise soudée.

Des opportunités de croissance personnelle et professionnelle dans un environnement en pleine expansion.

Si vous cherchez à élargir vos connaissances, à travailler dans un environnement collaboratif et à faire partie d'une équipe dotée d'une excellente chimie, nous vous encourageons à postuler. Rejoignez l'équipe pour créer des solutions de données innovantes et faire une différence dans le monde de la technologie et de l'ingénierie des données.

Prêt à prendre les devants ? Postulez dès aujourd'hui et faites partie de notre voyage passionnant

title: Data Entry Clerk - Vancouver 51249
description:
Are you looking to gain experience with a top 5 bank? Do you have excellent taxation skills? If so, this is a great opportunity for you!
Our client is looking for a Data Entry Clerk for a 4 months contract in Vancouver. This position is working in a hybrid remote mode, 2-3 days a week onsite. There is a high possibility for contract extension, conversion to full time employment as well.
Pay rate: $23.00/hour
Rotational shifts: Monday to Friday (8:30am-5:00pm)
Overtime required during peak season which is from Mid March - end of April

Advantages
●4 months contract
●Hybrid remote work
●Contract extension, conversion
●Start date is ASAP
●Competitive pay rate

Responsibilities
As a Data Entry Clerk, your duties will include but not be limited to:
●Preparing 250+ personal and trust returns for assigned clients in a timely and accurate manner.
●Gathering information from clients, CRA represents a client and various internal resources.
●Compiling a paperless working paper file of all tax documentation used to support the tax return for review by a CPA, prior to filing.
●Handling and responding to tax correspondence for assigned clients.
●Performing other duties and special projects as assigned, including filing.
●Contacting client or internal partner for missing information required for return preparation.
●Staying abreast of tax developments.

Qualifications
●Completion of or working towards a bachelor's degree, with a focus on taxation and/or accounting.
●1+ years experience in a professional tax services environment (i.e. tax services company, trust company or public accounting firm) preparing inter-vivos/testamentary trust (T3), and personal (T1) income tax returns for HNW individuals.
●Must have experience with T1 and T3 income tax returns
●Experience with CCH TaxPrep, CRA Represent a Client and MS Office.
●Effective time management, organizational, and communication skills.

Nice to Haves:

●Fluency in French, an asset.

Summary
Interested in the Data Entry Clerk role in Vancouver? Apply online today!
Candidates moving towards the next step of the recruitment process will be contacted.
